commit_message:
Inbound RR Updates

Change-Id: I1914b82ed2bfd44dcb4b8eff19070ad37a5b281c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-specs refs/changes/80/132080/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. =============================== Inbound Resource Record Updates =============================== This specification outlines the changes we need in order to support inbound updates of Resource Records using Dynamic Updates. `Dynamic Updates in the Domain Name System (DNS UPDATE) <https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2136>`_ Problem Description =================== There are multiple schenarios that come to mind here, typically dynamic updates are used by client to update their names by themselves. Some schenarios are listed below for context: - `Client / Server updating DNS names <http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc771255.aspx>`_ - OpenShift / Cloudfoundry updating instance names via nsupdate - Any arbitrary system that support dynamic name updates. Proposed change =============== This spec defines in detail the Designate needed for Inbound RR Updates. - Designate currently doesn't support multiple modifications within a single TX, so if multiple updates where to be issues as a series / mulitple RPC calls it would leave inconcistency for a Zone. - SOA serial update via dynamic update will not be allowed as this is done. Steps ^^^^^ #. Incoming RR update #. Process Zone section of request (**See RFC section 3.1**) #. Check that the Zone section contains 1 RR and that is a SOA else FORMERR. #. Check that the Zone name + class is managed by Designate ie not a Secondary zone and that it exists. #. Process Pre-requisite section of request. **See RFC section 2.4 / 3.2** - For each "update" check that they are within the scope of 1 RecordSet for now. - See above on why 1 RecordSet pr update is allowed. - If the SOA is requested to be modified signal FORMERR. #. Check / Authenticate TSIG for the requested RR change depending on scope. (**See RFC section 3.3**) - TSIG is out of scope for this specification, will be outlined in later specification. # Perform the Update (**See RFC section 3.4 / 3.5**) #. Find the RecordSet in the database to get the ID. #. Update the found RecordSet.RecordList deleting / adding records as needed. #. Call central.update_recordset() to persist changes. # Return response of update operation (**See RFC section 3.7**) MiniDNS changes --------------- New method - handle_dynamic_update(update) ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ A new method that handles most of the logic defined in the steps above.

commit_message:
Granular Access

Specification for granular access control support in Designate.

Change-Id: I3f526d22731ebc7bdc9dc01c987e13a516c5de4e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-specs refs/changes/15/179315/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. ============================= Transaction Support ============================= This specification outlines the changes needed in Designate to support granular access. https://blueprints.launchpad.net/designate/+spec/transaction-support Problem description =================== Designate needs to provide a way to manipulate multiple records/domains with transaction support built into it. For example, a tenant who owns multiple domains should be able to add records in one domain while deleting in another domain. All of this manipulation should be either successful or rolled back together. At a minimum, this feature needs to work on a single domain where adding some records while deleting some records should be done with transaction support built in. Proposed change =============== Here is where you cover the change you propose to make in detail. How do you propose to solve this problem? If this is one part of a larger effort make it clear where this piece ends. In other words, what's the scope of this effort? Include where in the designate tree hierarchy this will reside. API Changes ----------- Include API Changes here. If you are adding endpoints / add major modifications please ensure you have examples for calls / results - eg: POST /v2/doohickey ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ This creates a doohicky. It returns an ID and the doohickey .. code-block:: http POST /v2/doohickey HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/json Content-Type: application/json { "doohickey":{ "foo":"bar" } } HTTP/1.1 201 Created Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8 Location: /v2/doohickey/cddda8f0-f558-11e3-a3ac-0800200c9a66 { "doohickey":{ "id":"cddda8f0-f558-11e3-a3ac-0800200c9a66", "foo":"bar", "links":{ "self" : "/v2/doohickey/cddda8f0-f558-11e3-a3ac-0800200c9a66" } } } It may be usefull to add a table with the parameters, and a info about them +-----------+--------------------------------+----------+ | Parameter | Description | Required | +===========+================================+==========+ | foo | the foo value for the doohicky | Yes | +-----------+--------------------------------+----------+ Central Changes --------------- Any changes to the central service Storage Changes --------------- Any changes to the DB. This should be a table (if creating a new table) eg: New Table - DooHickey ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ +-----+---------+-----------+---------+ | Row | Type | Nullable? | Unique? | +=====+=========+===========+=========+ | id | uuid | No | Yes | +-----+---------+-----------+---------+ | foo | VARCHAR | No | No | +-----+---------+-----------+---------+ Other Changes ------------- Any other changes to Designate, broken down by which sub system is being changed Alternatives ------------ This is an optional section, where it does apply we'd just like a demonstration that some thought has been put into why the proposed approach is the best one. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- bhvenkatakrishna rjrjr Primary assignee: bhvenkatakrishna rjrjr Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Liberty-1 Work Items ---------- Work items or tasks -- break the feature up into the things that need to be done to implement it. Those parts might end up being done by different people, but we're mostly trying to understand the timeline for implementation. Dependencies ============ - Include specific references to specs and/or blueprints in designate, or in other projects, that this one either depends on or is related to. - Does this feature require any new library dependencies or code otherwise not included in OpenStack? Or does it depend on a specific version of library?

commit_message:
Transaction Support

Specifications for Transaction support in Designate.

Change-Id: I0b93da6e5a9edf41ca2e3faeebdd7b9f4c0b3016
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-specs refs/changes/84/180784/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. ============================= Transaction Support ============================= This specification outlines the changes needed in Designate to support granular access. https://blueprints.launchpad.net/designate/+spec/transaction-support Problem description =================== Designate needs to provide a way to manipulate multiple records/domains with transaction support built into it. For example, a tenant who owns multiple domains should be able to add records in one domain while deleting in another domain. All of this manipulation should be either successful or rolled back together. At a minimum, this feature needs to work on a single domain where adding some records while deleting some records should be done with transaction support built in. Proposed change =============== API Changes ----------- Include API Changes here. If you are adding endpoints / add major modifications please ensure you have examples for calls / results - eg: POST /v2/doohickey ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ This creates a doohicky. It returns an ID and the doohickey .. code-block:: http POST /v2/doohickey HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/json Content-Type: application/json { "doohickey":{ "foo":"bar" } } HTTP/1.1 201 Created Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8 Location: /v2/doohickey/cddda8f0-f558-11e3-a3ac-0800200c9a66 { "doohickey":{ "id":"cddda8f0-f558-11e3-a3ac-0800200c9a66", "foo":"bar", "links":{ "self" : "/v2/doohickey/cddda8f0-f558-11e3-a3ac-0800200c9a66" } } } It may be usefull to add a table with the parameters, and a info about them +-----------+--------------------------------+----------+ | Parameter | Description | Required | +===========+================================+==========+ | foo | the foo value for the doohicky | Yes | +-----------+--------------------------------+----------+ Central Changes --------------- Any changes to the central service Storage Changes --------------- Any changes to the DB. This should be a table (if creating a new table) eg: New Table - DooHickey ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ +-----+---------+-----------+---------+ | Row | Type | Nullable? | Unique? | +=====+=========+===========+=========+ | id | uuid | No | Yes | +-----+---------+-----------+---------+ | foo | VARCHAR | No | No | +-----+---------+-----------+---------+ Other Changes ------------- Any other changes to Designate, broken down by which sub system is being changed Alternatives ------------ This is an optional section, where it does apply we'd just like a demonstration that some thought has been put into why the proposed approach is the best one. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- bhvenkatakrishna rjrjr Primary assignee: bhvenkatakrishna rjrjr Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Liberty-1 Work Items ---------- Work items or tasks -- break the feature up into the things that need to be done to implement it. Those parts might end up being done by different people, but we're mostly trying to understand the timeline for implementation. Dependencies ============ - Include specific references to specs and/or blueprints in designate, or in other projects, that this one either depends on or is related to. - Does this feature require any new library dependencies or code otherwise not included in OpenStack? Or does it depend on a specific version of library?

commit_message:
Set discovery_default_driver=pxe_ipmitool and add missing release note

This is a follow-up to commit 350aeaff66d7481cc86eb362477f0270af6e9bca.

1. Change the default driver for new nodes to pxe_ipmitool as it's our
   go-to default driver.

2. Add a release note with a link to more details.

Change-Id: I3535cbfbffd2ce394b4e828c53a7fba6ee46fb5c
Implements: blueprint inspector-node-autodiscovery

added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/designate/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ================= Structured Data ================= Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/designate/+spec/api-v2-structured-data-format This change will allow records to be presented as structured data, instead of the text DNS representation Problem description =================== Some DNS RRTypes are made up of several sections of data, and when represented as a single string, can be confusing to understand for a user. Proposed change =============== This change will allow API users to send and receive Records in a structured form API Changes ----------- GET /v2/zones/<id>/recordsets/<id> ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ .. code-block:: http GET /v2/zones/2150b1bf-dee2-4221-9d85-11f7886fb15f/recordsets/f7b10e9b-0cae-4a91-b162-562bc6096648 HTTP/1.1 Host: 127.0.0.1:9001 Accept: application/openstack-dns-v2-json Content-Type: application/json .. code-block:: http HTTP/1.1 200 OK Vary: Accept Accept: application/openstack-dns-v2-json { "description": "This is an example recordset.", "links": { "self": "https://127.0.0.1:9001/v2/zones/2150b1bf-dee2-4221-9d85-11f7886fb15f/recordsets/f7b10e9b-0cae-4a91-b162-562bc6096648" }, "updated_at": null, "records": [ { "algorithm": 1, "fp_type": 1, "fingerprint": "253d9636219be6aec03d06359837e0604b370372" } ], "ttl": 3600, "id": "f7b10e9b-0cae-4a91-b162-562bc6096648", "name": "example.org.", "zone_id": "2150b1bf-dee2-4221-9d85-11f7886fb15f", "created_at": "2014-10-24T19:59:44.000000", "version": 1, "type": "SSHFP" } The structure of the records is currently represented in the rrdata\_\* objects in designate/objects Central Changes --------------- None Storage Changes --------------- None Other Changes ------------- Designate Object Adapters ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ The object adapters will change to take the object, and request. From this data the object will use the registry to find a adapter that can render / parse the required content-type Alternatives ------------ Continue as is Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: grahamhayes Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Liberty-1 Work Items ---------- * API Content-Types * Adapters * Designate Bindings / Openstack client Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
break into 2 BP's, one for configuable pool backends and one for dynamic pools

Change-Id: I69a155ce1b945ee9bfe9402696949ba3875c7fad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-specs refs/changes/45/252745/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/designate/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ========================= Dynamic Pool Management ========================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/designate/+spec/dynamic-pools Problem description =================== This blueprint proposes a clear differentiation of public and private pool to address the need of split horizon DNS. To allow scalability for tens of thousands of tenants who has the private versions of their DNS zones, we need to let one pool manager service be able to manage all pools, and the private pools should be able to be created through REST API, in addition to static configurations in *designate.conf* file. Proposed change =============== We introduce a 'type' attribute in the pool object to distinguish a pool is for public or private versions of zones. Public pools are shared across different tenants. A private pool is dedicated to the tenant who creates it. A tenant can have at most one private pool and all private version zones would go to the dedicated private pool for that tenant. API Changes ----------- Pool object ^^^^^^^^^^^ +----------------+------------------------+----------------+---------+--------------------------+ | Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description | +================+========================+================+=========+==========================+ | type | ENUM(private, public) | Yes | None | Private or public pool | +----------------+------------------------+----------------+---------+--------------------------+ | targets | List | Yes | None | Pool Targets | +----------------+------------------------+----------------+---------+--------------------------+ | also_notifies | List | No | None | also-notify name servers | +----------------+------------------------+----------------+---------+--------------------------+ The *type* field is introduced to differentiate between public and private pools. The pool target is conceptually changed to be the group of *pool ns record*, *name server*, and *backend*. The following table list the objects in pool target. +------------+-------------+-------------------------+----------+---------+---------------------------+ | Object | Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description | +============+=============+=========================+==========+=========+===========================+ | ns_record | hostname | String | Yes | None | Host name in FQDN. | +------------+-------------+-------------------------+----------+---------+---------------------------+ | | priority | Integer | No | None | NS record priority. | +------------+-------------+-------------------------+----------+---------+---------------------------+ | backend | type | Enum (bind9, powerdns, | Yes | None | Backend type. | | | | agent, dynect, akamai) | | | | +------------+-------------+-------------------------+----------+---------+---------------------------+ | | options | List | No | None | A set of key-value pairs. | +------------+-------------+-------------------------+----------+---------+---------------------------+ | nameserver | host | String | No | None | IP address. | +------------+-------------+-------------------------+----------+---------+---------------------------+ | | port | Integer | No | 53 | Port number. | +------------+-------------+-------------------------+----------+---------+---------------------------+ | masters | | List | No | No | List of <host:port>. | +------------+-------------+-------------------------+----------+---------+---------------------------+ The *nameserver* is optional, which leaves design space to future Designate integration with Neutron to provide private authoritative DNS for tenant networks. An alternative solution is to introduce a *neutron-dns-agent* to spawn bind9 or powerdns processes in separate network namespaces for separate tenant. In this case, there might be a scheduler to assign pool targets to different *neutron-dns-agent*. The *namesever* information can be derived from *neutron-dns-agent*. The *backend* and *ns_record* must be provided for a *target* to create a pool. The *options* field in *backend* is a collection of key-value pairs and different backend accepts various options, see as following table. +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | Type | Options | Description | +===========+=====================+=====================================================+ | bind9 | rndc_host | IP address of RNDC server. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | rndc_port | Port number of RNDC server. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | rndc_key_file | Path to RNDC key file. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | rndc_config_file | Path to RNDC config file. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | clean_zonefile | Whether to delete the zonefile when delete a zone. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | powerdns | connection | DB connection URL. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | agent | host | IP address. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | port | Port number. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | dynect | custome_name | Custome name. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | username | User name. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | password | Password. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | contact_nickname | Contact nickname. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | tsig_key_name | TSIG key name. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | akamai | username | User name. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | password | Password. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | tsig_key_name | TSIG key name. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | tsig_key_algorithm | TSIG key algorithm. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | tsig_key_secret | TSIG key secret. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | nsd4 | host | IP address. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | port | Port number. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | certfile | Path to certification file. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | keyfile | Path to key file. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | pattern | Zone pattern: master or slave. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | infoblox | wapi_url | Infoblox WAPI URL. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | username | User name. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | password | Password. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | ns_group | Name server group. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | sslverify | SSL verification. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | network_view | Network view. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | dns_view | DNS view. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | multi_tenant | Multi-tenant DNS view. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | designate | auth_url | Authentication URL. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | username | User name. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | password | Password. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | tenant_name | Tenant name. (Keystone v2) | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | tenant_id | Tenant ID. (Keystone v2) | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | project_name | Project name. (Keystone v3) | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | project_domain_name | Project domain name. (Keystone v3) | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | user_domain_name | User domain name. (Keystone v3) | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | | service_type | Service type of OpenStack DNS. | +-----------+---------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ Create Pool ^^^^^^^^^^^ Two ways to create pools: 1. *From config file*: compatible with the current static pool configuration. However, the config file is re-structured as below. .. code-block:: ini [pool:794ccc2c-d751-44fe-b57f-8894c9f5c842] targets = f26e0b32-736f-4f0a-831b-039a415c481e also_notifies = 192.0.2.1:53, 192.0.2.2:53 [pool_target:f26e0b32-736f-4f0a-831b-039a415c481e] backend = f00f40e7-143f-4b1e-b97f-797998847549 nameserver = 0f66b842-96c2-4189-93fc-1dc95a08b012 masters = 192.168.27.100:5354 [pool_target_backend:f00f40e7-143f-4b1e-b97f-797998847549] type = bind9 options = rndc_host: 192.168.27.100, rndc_port: 953, rndc_config_file: /etc/bind/rndc.conf, rndc_key_file: /etc/bind/rndc.key, clean_zonefile: false [pool_target_nameserver:0f66b842-96c2-4189-93fc-1dc95a08b012] port = 53 host = 192.168.27.100 2. *From RESTful API*: introduced to create pools dynamically. .. code-block:: http POST /v2/pools HTTP/1.1 Host: 127.0.0.1:9001 Accept: application/json Content-Type: application/json { "pool": { "name": "this is a public pool", "type": "public", "targets": [ { "backend": { "type": "bind9", "options": { "rndc_host": "192.168.1.1", "rndc_port": 953, "rndc_config_file": "/etc/rndc.conf" }, }, "ns_record": { "hostname": "ns1.example.com.", "priority": 10 }, "nameserver": { "host": "192.168.1.1", "port": 53 }, "masters": ["127.0.0.1:5354"] }, { "backend": { "type": "bind9", "options": { "rndc_host": "192.168.2.1", "rndc_port": 953, "rndc_config_file": "/etc/rndc.conf" }, }, "ns_record": { "hostname": "ns2.example.com.", "priority": 20 }, "nameserver": { "host": "192.168.2.1", "port": 53 }, "masters": ["127.0.0.1:5354"] } ] } } .. code-block:: http HTTP/1.1 201 Created Content-Type: application/json { "name": "this is a public pool", "type": "public", "id": "05a0a390-163c-4ba2-b302-64dc23905c8f", "targets": [ { "id": "aeed8f12-2dec-49e4-ae81-3a8015de952f", "backend": { "type": "bind9", "options": { "rndc_host": "192.168.1.1", "rndc_port": 953, "rndc_config_file": "/etc/rndc.conf" }, }, "ns_record": { "hostname": "ns1.example.com.", "priority": 10 }, "nameserver": { "host": "192.168.1.1", "port": 53 }, "masters": ["127.0.0.1:5354"] }, { "id": "73b2acc2-24c7-4e42-b12b-d076bf9ba7a1", "backend": { "type": "bind9", "options": { "rndc_host": "192.168.2.1", "rndc_port": 953, "rndc_config_file": "/etc/rndc.conf" }, }, "ns_record": { "hostname": "ns2.example.com.", "priority": 20 }, "nameserver": { "host": "192.168.2.1", "port": 53 }, "masters": ["127.0.0.1:5354"] } ], "links": { "self": "http://127.0.0.1:9001/v2/pools/05a0a390-163c-4ba2-b302-64dc23905c8f" }, "created_at": "2015-11-05T11:16:18.000000", "updated_at": null, "attributes": { }, "project_id": "52ab70dd560641448ee0710e2b624a41", "description": null } Central changes --------------- The pool CRUD methods in Central service will send RPC to pool manager service for multiple pool management. Pool manager changes -------------------- Pool manager topic ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Since we need one pool manager service to manage all pools, there is no need to append *pool_id* to pool manager RPC topic. All methods in pool manager RPC client that originally ends *pool_id* in the RPC topic would be changed to pass *pool_id* as one argument in the RPC method. Multiple pools ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ The pool manager service is changed to be able to manage multiple pools. Pool manager service will add pool CRUD methods in its RPC endpoint, which are called by Central service. create_pool(self, context, pool) """""""""""""""""""""""""""""""" +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ | **Parameter** | **Description** | **Required** | +===============+===============================================+==============+ | *context* | Designate context | Yes | +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ | *pool* | The created pool | Yes | +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ After Central creates pool in storage, it calls this RPC method to pass the created pool to pool manager service. Pool manager service will store this pool object in its cache. delete_pool(self, context, pool) """""""""""""""""""""""""""""""" +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ | **Parameter** | **Description** | **Required** | +===============+===============================================+==============+ | *context* | Designate context | Yes | +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ | *pool* | The pool to be deleted | Yes | +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ Before Central deletes pool in storage, it calls this RPC method to pool manager service to remove pool object from its cache. update_pool(self, context, pool) """""""""""""""""""""""""""""""" +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ | **Parameter** | **Description** | **Required** | +===============+===============================================+==============+ | *context* | Designate context | Yes | +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ | *pool* | The pool to be deleted | Yes | +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ After Central updates pool in storage, it calls this RPC method to pool manager service to update pool object in its cache. Pool cache ^^^^^^^^^^ The pool manager service needs to create a pool cache to store all managed pools. *pool_id* is used as the key, and the combination of other fields in pool object are the value. Meanwhile, a *timeout* is associated with each pool cache entry. The pool manager service would pull the pool information from Central once the pool cache entry expired. Moreover, whenever pools are updated, the corresponding pool cache entry should be updated accordingly. Pool extension handlers ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Pool extension handlers will be introduced into pool manager service, which implement routines for the CRUD of pools and domains. Pool manager service loads pool extension handlers from configuration option *pool_extensions* in [service:pool_manager] section. .. code-block:: ini [service:pool_manager] pool_extensions = public, private The pool and domain CRUD methods in pool manager service will be changed as dispatchers, which passes the received RPC message to appropriate pool extension handler(s). The pool extension module will house a base extension, and two concrete extension handlers for public and private pools, respectively. Pool manager service will dispath its received RPC message to the routines in these two pool extension handlers based on the pool's type. The following methods would compose the base extension. create_pool(self, context, pool) """""""""""""""""""""""""""""""" +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ | **Parameter** | **Description** | **Required** | +===============+===============================================+==============+ | *context* | Designate context | Yes | +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ | *pool* | The created pool | Yes | +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ This method will do further handling for pool creation. E.g., private pool extension handler may deploy the name servers whenever a pool is created. delete_pool(self, context, pool) """""""""""""""""""""""""""""""" +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ | **Parameter** | **Description** | **Required** | +===============+===============================================+==============+ | *context* | Designate context | Yes | +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ | *pool* | The pool to be deleted | Yes | +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ This method will do further handling for pool deletion. E.g., private pool extension handler may undeploy the name servers whenever a pool is deleted. update_pool(self, context, pool) """""""""""""""""""""""""""""""" +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ | **Parameter** | **Description** | **Required** | +===============+===============================================+==============+ | *context* | Designate context | Yes | +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ | *pool* | The pool to be updated | Yes | +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ This method will do further handling for pool update. E.g., private pool extension handler may deploy a new name server when a new target added in the pool and transfer zones to the new deployed name server. create_domain(self, context, domain) """""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""" +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ | **Parameter** | **Description** | **Required** | +===============+===============================================+==============+ | *context* | Designate context | Yes | +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ | *domain* | The domain to be created | Yes | +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ This method creates zone on the target backends in a specific pool (note: *pool_id* is carried in domain object). delete_domain(self, context, domain) """""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""" +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ | **Parameter** | **Description** | **Required** | +===============+===============================================+==============+ | *context* | Designate context | Yes | +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ | *domain* | The domain to be deleted | Yes | +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ This method deletes zone on the target backends in a specific pool (note: *pool_id* is carried in domain object). update_domain(self, context, domain) """""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""" +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ | **Parameter** | **Description** | **Required** | +===============+===============================================+==============+ | *context* | Designate context | Yes | +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ | *domain* | The domain to be updated | Yes | +---------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------+ This method update zone on the target backends in a specific pool (note: *pool_id* is carried in domain object). Storage changes --------------- New Table - pool_target_masters ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ +----------------+--------------------+-----------+---------+--------------------------------+ | Column | Type | Nullable? | Unique? | Description | +================+====================+===========+=========+================================+ | id | CHAR(32) | No | Yes | PK | +----------------+--------------------+-----------+---------+--------------------------------+ | created_at | DATETIME | No | No | UTC time of first create | +----------------+--------------------+-----------+---------+--------------------------------+ | updated_at | DATETIME | No | No | UTC time of last update | +----------------+--------------------+-----------+---------+--------------------------------+ | host | VARCHAR(255) | No | No | IPv4 or IPv6 address | +----------------+--------------------+-----------+---------+--------------------------------+ | port | INT(8) | No | No | Port number | +----------------+--------------------+-----------+---------+--------------------------------+ | pool_target_id | CHAR(32) | No | No | FK to ID on pool_targets table | +----------------+--------------------+-----------+---------+--------------------------------+ New Table - pool_target_backend_options ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ +----------------+--------------------+-----------+---------+--------------------------------+ | Column | Type | Nullable? | Unique? | Description | +================+====================+===========+=========+================================+ | id | CHAR(32) | No | Yes | PK | +----------------+--------------------+-----------+---------+--------------------------------+ | created_at | DATETIME | No | No | UTC time of first create | +----------------+--------------------+-----------+---------+--------------------------------+ | updated_at | DATETIME | No | No | UTC time of last update | +----------------+--------------------+-----------+---------+--------------------------------+ | key | VARCHAR(255) | No | No | Key | +----------------+--------------------+-----------+---------+--------------------------------+ | value | VARCHAR(255) | No | No | Value | +----------------+--------------------+-----------+---------+--------------------------------+ | pool_target_id | CHAR(32) | No | No | FK to ID on pool_targets table | +----------------+--------------------+-----------+---------+--------------------------------+ New Table - pool_targets ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ +--------------------+------------------------------+-----------+---------+---------------------------------+ | Column | Type | Nullable? | Unique? | Notes | +====================+==============================+===========+=========+=================================+ | id | CHAR(32) | No | Yes | PK | +--------------------+------------------------------+-----------+---------+---------------------------------+ | created_at | DATETIME | No | No | UTC time of last update | +--------------------+------------------------------+-----------+---------+---------------------------------+ | updated_at | DATETIME | No | No | Server ID | +--------------------+------------------------------+-----------+---------+---------------------------------+ | backend_type | ENUM('bind9', 'powerdns', | No | No | Target backend type | | | 'agent', 'nsd4', 'infoblox', | | | | | | 'akamai', 'dynect', | | | | | | 'designate') | | | | +--------------------+------------------------------+-----------+---------+---------------------------------+ | ns_record_hostname | DATETIME | No | No | Target ns_record hostname | +--------------------+------------------------------+-----------+---------+---------------------------------+ | ns_record_priority | DATETIME | No | No | Target ns_record priority | +--------------------+------------------------------+-----------+---------+---------------------------------+ | nameserver_host | DATETIME | No | No | Target name server hostname | +--------------------+------------------------------+-----------+---------+---------------------------------+ | nameserver_port | DATETIME | No | No | Target name server port | +--------------------+------------------------------+-----------+---------+---------------------------------+ | pool_id | CHAR(32) | No | No | FK to ID on pools table | +--------------------+------------------------------+-----------+---------+---------------------------------+ Remove Table - pool_ns_records ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Since the pool NS records are introduced into the new *pool_targets* table, we can remove the old *pool_ns_records* table. Backend driver change --------------------- An *__backend_adapters__* attribute would be introcued into the backend drivers in order to show with which pool extension handlers the backend would be able to work together. *__backend_adapters__* would be a list of enumerated values among below items: - public: be able to work with public pool extension handler; - private: be table to work with private pool extension handler; - none: none of the above, e.g., agent-bind9 is a backend driver for agent. +-------------------+------------------------+ | Backend | __backend_adapters__ | +===================+========================+ | bind9 | ['public'] | +-------------------+------------------------+ | powerdns | ['public'] | +-------------------+------------------------+ | agent | ['public'] | +-------------------+------------------------+ | dynect | ['public'] | +-------------------+------------------------+ | akamai | ['public'] | +-------------------+------------------------+ | infoblox | ['public'] | +-------------------+------------------------+ | nsd4 | ['public'] | +-------------------+------------------------+ | designate | ['public', 'private'] | +-------------------+------------------------+ | agent-bind9 | None | +-------------------+------------------------+ | agent-denominator | None | +-------------------+------------------------+ Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: jet-rongl Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Mitaka-3

commit_message:
Expose Inherited Recordset TTLs

This spec details some of the options we have around the issue
that Recordsets currently show a "null" TTL, even when they have one
that is inherited from the parent zone.

Originally came from https://bugs.launchpad.net/designate/+bug/1533301

Change-Id: I7069c61b9dde51754be0c67e488b8b2bb564d93b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-specs refs/changes/48/273148/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/designate/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ================================= Exposing Inherited Recordset TTLs ================================= Currently Recordsets that don't have a specific TTL set on them report their TTL as "NULL" when in fact, the TTL is inherited from the zone. A "NULL" TTL doesn't really make sense, so we should figure out a way to show users that the TTL is actually from the zone. Proposed change =============== There are a few ways to address the issue. Ordered by increasing amount of work. Documentation Only ------------------ We could make a simple documentation change to note the current state of how the TTL works, that it is inherited from the zone, unless otherwise set. This is obviously straightforward, but people who don't read the docs closely will still be confused. Show Inherited TTL Opaquely --------------------------- The TTL field on Recordsets could be populated in the API with the zone TTL unless the Recordset has had an explicit TTL set. This satisfies the desire to see the TTL in the API, but could result in unexpected changes for a user if they didn't read the associated docuemntation and changed their zone TTL. Set a Default Recordset TTL --------------------------- The TTL field for Recordsets could be set via configuration value, and only be overridden by users, so in this case, it would no longer inherit from the zone. The default could be clearly documented, and should be somewhat simple to understand, even if it doesn't make a lot of sense to those who understand DNS. Show an inherited_ttl field --------------------------- Create a new API field that shows an ``inherited_ttl`` equal to the zone TTL if no explicit TTL has been set. The value would be present, and would take effect if no TTL had been set. Once a TTL has been set on the Recordset, the inherited ttl would probably still be shown. This involves an API change. Recordsets would now have an ``inherited_ttl`` field that would be immutable, except by changing the zone TTL. GET /v2/zones/<id>/recordsets/<id> ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ .. code-block:: http GET /v2/zones/<id>/recordsets/<id> HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/json Content-Type: application/json HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8 Location: /v2/doohickey/cddda8f0-f558-11e3-a3ac-0800200c9a66 { "description": "This is an example recordset.", "links": { "self": "https://127.0.0.1:9001/v2/zones/2150b1bf-dee2-4221-9d85-11f7886fb15f/recordsets/f7b10e9b-0cae-4a91-b162-562bc6096648" }, "updated_at": null, "records": [ "10.1.0.2" ], "ttl": null, "inherited_ttl": 3600, "id": "f7b10e9b-0cae-4a91-b162-562bc6096648", "name": "example.org.", "zone_id": "2150b1bf-dee2-4221-9d85-11f7886fb15f", "created_at": "2014-10-24T19:59:44.000000", "version": 1, "type": "A" } Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: None Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Mitaka Work Items ---------- Figure out what to do.

commit_message:
Added a new specification for Tenant domainID for Designate Sink

Change-Id: I17c7523606fe7383e8127e4af8eb1feb49e96cea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-specs refs/changes/98/341398/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================== Tenant DomainID for Designate-Sink ==================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/designate/+spec/tenant-domainid-for-designate-sink Right now Designate Sink creates DNS records in a predefined domain which is common for all the tenants. Designate should have this feature where records are created in tenant domains so that tenants can make changes to the records created by Designate Sink if required. Problem description =================== Desigante Sink create DNS A records in a predefined domain. Tenant doesn't have access to these records and can never access them even if he needs to update them. Proposed change =============== Right now designate-sink handlers in designate.conf has hard coded domain_id. We can change this to %(domain) so that base.py can look for a domain matching the default domain convention in designate.conf and create records in that domain. If domain doesn't exist then create the domain following the domain convention in designate.conf Sink Changes =============== nova.py and neutron.py needs to be updated so that tenant's domain for sink is considered. If there is no domain for the tenant then create the default domain. NotificationHandler of base.py needs to be updated with create_domain method which will add the domain for the tenant. API Changes =========== No Changes to the API. Storage Chages ============== No Changes. Alternatives ============ Alternatively domain_id in designate.conf can be hard coded to zone/domainid so that all records created by designate-sink endup in one common domain. Implementation ============== Update designate.conf.sample to refelect the default domain convention under nova_fixed and neutron_floatingip. base.py to check if default domain is already present else create it. If domain_format is empty then look for domain_id and consider that domain. If either of domain_format or domain_id are empty then sink will consider hardcoded domain_format in nova.py and neutron.py respectively. Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: ramsateesh-talari Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: newton-2 Work Items ---------- Update nova.py Update neutron.py Update base.py

commit_message:
Add spec for /v2/reverse/fixedips API

Change-Id: I442c11b442358548538599458d5304a096739d45
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-specs refs/changes/65/355665/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================================== The design of /v2/reverse/fixedips API ====================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/designate/+spec/fixed-ip-ptrs Problem description =================== This spec proposes to add an API for PTR operations on the allocated fixed IP of cloud servers and load balancers. Proposed change =============== 1. CRUD operations on /v2/reverse/fixedips endpoint; 2. Optional IP validation via a pluggable way. API Changes ----------- API changes will be mainly about exposing the new API endpoint in controllers. POST /v2/reverse/fixedips ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Create a PTR record **Example request:** .. code-block:: http POST /v2/reverse/fixedips HTTP/1.1 Host: 127.0.0.1:9001 Accept: application/json Content-Type: application/json { "records" : [{ "name" : "email.example.com", "type" : "PTR", "data" : "192.168.1.2", "ttl" : 6000 }], "metadata" : { "region" : "region-1", "type" : "server", "instance": "db7eecc7-e1e3-4150-b9fb-2c80598b13e3" } } The metadata section is for ip ownership validation, and it is optional. **Example response:** .. code-block:: http HTTP/1.1 202 Accepted Content-Type: application/json { "records" : [{ "id" : "f7b10e9b-0cae-4a91-b162-562bc6096648", "name" : "email.example.com", "type" : "PTR", "data" : "192.168.1.2", "ttl" : 6000, "created_at" : "2016-08-01T20:09:48.094457", "description": null, "status": "PENDING", "project_id": "4335d1f0-f793-11e2-b778-0800200c9a66", }], } PUT /v2/reverse/fixedips/{ID} ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Modify a PTR record **Example request:** .. code-block:: http PUT /v2/reverse/fixedips/f7b10e9b-0cae-4a91-b162-562bc6096648 HTTP/1.1 Host: 127.0.0.1:9001 Accept: application/json Content-Type: application/json { "name" : "newemail.example.com", "ttl" : 6600, } **Example response:** .. code-block:: http HTTP/1.1 202 Accepted Content-Type: application/json { "id" : "f7b10e9b-0cae-4a91-b162-562bc6096648", "name" : "newemail.example.com", "type" : "PTR", "data" : "192.168.1.2", "ttl" : 6600, "created_at" : "2016-08-01T20:09:48.094457", "updated_at" : "2016-08-02T20:09:49.094450", "description": null, "status": "PENDING", "project_id": "4335d1f0-f793-11e2-b778-0800200c9a66", } GET /v2/reverse/fixedips ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ List PTR records owned by a project **Example request:** .. code-block:: http GET /v2/reverse/fixedips HTTP/1.1 Host: 127.0.0.1:9001 Accept: application/json Content-Type: application/json **Example response:** .. code-block:: http HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: application/json { "records": [ { "name": "newemail.example.com", "id": "f7b10e9b-0cae-4a91-b162-562bc6096648", "type": "PTR", "data": "192.168.1.2", "ttl": 6600, "updated": "2016-08-05T19:41:40.000+0000", "created": "2016-08-03T22:21:19.000+0000", "description": null, "project_id": "4335d1f0-f793-11e2-b778-0800200c9a66", "status": "ACTIVE", }, { "name": "email2.example.com", "id": "89acac79-38e7-497d-807c-a011e1310438", "type": "PTR", "data": "2001:4800:7812:514:be76:4eff:fe05:5bb8", "ttl": 900, "updated": "2016-08-05T19:48:21.000+0000", "created": "2016-08-05T19:48:21.000+0000", "description": null, "project_id": "4335d1f0-f793-11e2-b778-0800200c9a66", "status": "ACTIVE" } ], } GET /v2/reverse/fixedips/{ID} ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Show a PTR record **Example request:** .. code-block:: http GET /v2/reverse/fixedips/89acac79-38e7-497d-807c-a011e1310438 HTTP/1.1 Host: 127.0.0.1:9001 Accept: application/json Content-Type: application/json **Example response:** .. code-block:: http HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: application/json { "name": "email2.example.com", "id": "89acac79-38e7-497d-807c-a011e1310438", "type": "PTR", "data": "2001:4800:7812:514:be76:4eff:fe05:5bb8", "ttl": 900, "updated": "2016-08-05T19:48:21.000+0000", "created": "2016-08-05T19:48:21.000+0000", "description": null, "project_id": "4335d1f0-f793-11e2-b778-0800200c9a66", "status": "ACTIVE" } DELETE /v2/reverse/fixedips/{ID} ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Delete a PTR record **Example request:** .. code-block:: http DELETE /v2/reverse/fixedips/89acac79-38e7-497d-807c-a011e1310438 HTTP/1.1 Host: 127.0.0.1:9001 Accept: application/json Content-Type: application/json **Example response:** .. code-block:: http HTTP/1.1 202 Accepted Content-Type: application/json { "name": "email2.example.com", "id": "89acac79-38e7-497d-807c-a011e1310438", "type": "PTR", "data": "2001:4800:7812:514:be76:4eff:fe05:5bb8", "ttl": 900, "updated": "2016-08-05T19:48:21.000+0000", "created": "2016-08-05T19:48:21.000+0000", "description": null, "project_id": "4335d1f0-f793-11e2-b778-0800200c9a66", "status": "PENDING" } Central Changes --------------- Central communicates with storage upon messages received from api, and returns requested PTR objects to api. Storage Changes --------------- A new PTR table. Other Changes ------------- Any necessary changes to pool manager and miniDNS for backend persistence. Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- None Milestones ---------- newton-1 Work Items ---------- * Make code changes to api, central and storage * Add unit and functional tests. Dependencies ============ None

subject: Remove xrange
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-25 07:27:02.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/utils/__init__.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/2cb9e49eb4f5266581e2e5782113d237551b2e5e', 'message': "Remove xrange

In python 3, range() does what xrange() used to do and xrange() does not
exist. If you want to write code that will run on both Python 2 and
Python 3, you can't use xrange().

range() can actually be faster in some cases - eg. if iterating over the
same sequence multiple times. xrange() has to reconstruct the integer
object every time, but range() will have real integer objects.
(It will always perform worse in terms of memory however)

xrange() isn't usable in all cases where a real list is needed.
For instance, it doesn't support slices, or any list methods.

Change-Id: Ia105b03c52e40e680c67a1178ac67bc795e5b7f7
(cherry picked from commit 2a60feb847f5b8fc7933d8fcf9a1b31891f4c5ad)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove xrange

In python 3, range() does what xrange() used to do and xrange() does not
exist. If you want to write code that will run on both Python 2 and
Python 3, you can't use xrange().

range() can actually be faster in some cases - eg. if iterating over the
same sequence multiple times. xrange() has to reconstruct the integer
object every time, but range() will have real integer objects.
(It will always perform worse in terms of memory however)

xrange() isn't usable in all cases where a real list is needed.
For instance, it doesn't support slices, or any list methods.

Change-Id: Ia105b03c52e40e680c67a1178ac67bc795e5b7f7
(cherry picked from commit 2a60feb847f5b8fc7933d8fcf9a1b31891f4c5ad)

[H102 H103] Newly contributed Source Code should be licensed under
the Apache 2.0 license.
[H104] Files with no code shouldn't contain any license header nor
comments, and must be left completely empty.

Change-Id: I6856dd8585d1feb0ced54932a3e44cfcdb86a9e6
(cherry picked from commit 5ac665e6a5f4ba8790fe59fbb8463d484c4c6b1b)

commit_message:
Add Apache 2.0 license to source file

As per OpenStack licensing guide lines [1]:
[H102 H103] Newly contributed Source Code should be licensed under
the Apache 2.0 license.
[H104] Files with no code shouldn't contain any license header nor
comments, and must be left completely empty.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing

Change-Id: I6856dd8585d1feb0ced54932a3e44cfcdb86a9e6
(cherry picked from commit 5ac665e6a5f4ba8790fe59fbb8463d484c4c6b1b)

commit_message:
Enable cell_v2 setup by default

In Ocata, nova has made the cell_v2 setup mandatory as part of the
upgrade process in I72fb724dc13e1a5f4e97c58915b538ba761c582d. This
change makes the cell_v2 setup part of the default install for Ocata as
this feature will be required for some parts of nova in Ocata.

Depends-On: I693239ff5026f58a65eb6278b1a8fcb97af4f561
Depends-On: I08efa36f5f62ae406ab20e8da77c01fbf3d9b11f
Change-Id: I7839e3c8bfdec96b0d372e7a9d3511289e8004b9
Related-Bug: #1649341

deleted_lines: it { is_expected.to_not contain_class('nova::db::sync_cell_v2') } :cellv2_setup => true it { is_expected.to contain_class('nova::db::sync_cell_v2') }

commit_message:
Fix missing role_id

Error was "No path parameter ``role_id`` found in rest_parameter stanza.:

Basically it means that the parameter role_id is used, but not defined in a corresponding yaml file.

Mailing list post on openstack-dev:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-January/110606.html for reference.

Change-Id: Id5863a70f2432a2ae22164aa66e29ae739ab3e11
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstackdocstheme refs/changes/41/426941/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: role_id: in: body required: true type: string description: | The unique identifier for the role, which enables defining role assignments for multiple users in multiple projects.

commit_message:
Switch to decorators.idempotent_id on compute.*

So many modules are using test.idempotent_id and this is for
switching to decorators.idempotent_id on compute.*.

Change-Id: Ib4ace375a41b9607d1b1cea7dda296fb601a0264
Related-Bug: #1616913

commit_message:
Modify use of assertTrue(A in B)

Developers should use assertIn(A, B) instead of assertTrue(A in B ).
Developers should use assertNotIn(A, B) instead of assertFalse(A in B ).

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ibfb5bda501015383ac170544129c280f99f4f5ed
(cherry picked from commit 211c465c0b9c209957cee466060a40ac1dc6ddb8)

commit_message:
Fix LOG.warn to LOG.warning

logging.warn is deprecated in Python 3.
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning

Change-Id: I13852edf784a26e20ade8e456d62d57e8dab0878

commit_message:
Fix the retrieval of NS recordsets

The results from NS recordsets retrieval could be paginated,
in which case the managed one may not get returned in the first page.

This patch ensures the managed NS recordset always appears in the
first paginated page.

Change-Id: I3ef3b5dd3a09fae7e341da280d60d3b7212e1249
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/79/313779/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Get NS recordset, ensure we always get the managed one if it exists # regardless of pagination context, criterion={'zone_id': zone['id'], 'type': "NS"}, sort_key='created_at', sort_dir='asc'
deleted_lines: # Get NS recordset context, criterion={'zone_id': zone['id'], 'type': "NS"}

added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Rackspace Inc. # # Author: Eric Larson <eric.larson@rackspace.com> # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import unittest import socket import mock from designate.zone_manager import alias from designate import exceptions class TestALIASRecordFlattener(unittest.TestCase): def setUp(self): self.context = mock.Mock() self.central_api = mock.Mock() self.zone_id = 1234 self.recordset = mock.Mock() self.storage = mock.Mock() self.flattener = alias.ALIASRecordFlattener( self.context, self.central_api, self.zone_id, self.recordset, self.storage ) def test_init_allows_managed_records(self): assert self.context.edit_managed_records is True def test_get_record_obj(self): self.flattener.get_record_obj(1234) self.storage.get_record.assert_called_with(self.context, 1234) @mock.patch.object(alias, 'dns') def test_find_record_target_ips_success(self, dns): result = self.flattener.find_record_target_ips('foo.com.') dns.resolver.query.assert_called_with('foo.com.', 'A') assert result == [r.address for r in dns.resolver.query()] @mock.patch.object(alias, 'dns') def test_find_record_target_ips_nxdomain(self, dns): dns.resolver.query.side_effect = [dns.resolver.NXDOMAIN] result = self.flattener.find_record_target_ips('foo.com.') assert result == [] @mock.patch.object(alias, 'dns') def test_find_record_target_ips_socket_error(self, dns): dns.resolver.query.side_effect = [socket.gaierror] result = self.flattener.find_record_target_ips('foo.com.') assert result == [] def test_create_recordlist_from_record(self): alias_record = mock.Mock(data='foo.com.', id='1234') self.flattener.find_record_target_ips = mock.Mock() self.flattener.find_record_target_ips.return_value = [ '192.168.1.1', '192.168.1.2' ] a_records = self.flattener.create_recordlist_from_record(alias_record) assert len(a_records) == 2 assert a_records[0].data == '192.168.1.1' assert a_records[1].data == '192.168.1.2' assert a_records[0].managed assert a_records[0].managed_resource_type == 'ALIAS' assert a_records[0].managed_resource_id == '1234' @mock.patch.object(alias, 'objects') def test_update_recordset(self, objects): alias_record = mock.Mock( data='foo.com.', id='1234', name='foo zone', ) self.flattener.find_record_target_ips = mock.Mock() self.flattener.find_record_target_ips.return_value = [ '192.168.1.1', '192.168.1.2' ] self.flattener.create_recordset(alias_record) records = self.flattener.create_recordlist_from_record(alias_record) objects.RecordSet.assert_called_with( name=self.recordset.name, type='A', # TODO(elarson): This ttl should be from the upstream A # record(s) ttl=3600, records=records, visible='mdns' ) self.central_api.create_recordset.assert_called_with( self.context, self.zone_id, objects.RecordSet() ) def test_existing_recordset_found(self): result = self.flattener.existing_recordset() assert result self.central_api.find_recordset.assert_called_with( self.context, criterion={ 'zone_id': self.zone_id, 'type': 'A' } ) def test_existing_recordset_not_found(self): not_found = exceptions.RecordSetNotFound() self.central_api.find_recordset.side_effect = not_found result = self.flattener.existing_recordset() assert result is None def test_find_serial(self): serial = self.flattener.find_serial() self.central_api.get_zone.assert_called_with( self.context, self.zone_id ) assert serial == self.central_api.get_zone().serial def test_flatten_record_create(self): self.flattener.existing_recordset = mock.Mock(return_value=None) self.flattener.create_recordset = mock.Mock() self.flattener.flatten_record('foo') self.flattener.create_recordset.assert_called_with('foo') def test_flatten_record_update(self): self.flattener.existing_recordset = mock.Mock(return_value='original') self.flattener.update_recordset = mock.Mock() self.flattener.flatten_record('foo') self.flattener.update_recordset.assert_called_with('original', 'foo') def test_flatten(self): record = mock.Mock(name='foo.com', data='bar.com.') self.recordset.records = [record] self.flattener.flatten_record = mock.Mock() self.flattener.flatten() self.flattener.flatten_record.assert_called_with(record) def test_delete(self): recordset = mock.Mock() self.flattener.existing_recordset = mock.Mock( return_value=recordset ) self.flattener.delete() self.central_api.delete_recordset.assert_called_with( self.context, self.zone_id, recordset.id ) def test_delete_noop_when_not_exists(self): self.flattener.existing_recordset = mock.Mock(return_value=None) self.flattener.delete() assert not self.central_api.delete_recordset.called class TestALIASEntryFunctions(unittest.TestCase): @mock.patch.object(alias, 'ALIASRecordFlattener') def test_flatten(self, flattener_class): alias.flatten('foo') # Ensure we pass though *args flattener_class.assert_called_with('foo') assert flattener_class().flatten.called @mock.patch.object(alias, 'ALIASRecordFlattener') def test_delete(self, flattener_class): alias.delete('foo') # Ensure we pass though *args flattener_class.assert_called_with('foo') assert flattener_class().delete.called

commit_message:
Move the transaction decorator to storage

The goal is to find a better place for the transaction decorator and
adjust the implementation to allow disabling the decorator. This will
allow testing transactional methods in isolation without having to mock
out all the code that tests retries and handles transactions.

Here is an example of disabling the transaction:

   @mock.patch('designate.storage.transaction.ENABLE_TRANSACTION', False)
   def test_method_in_isolation(self):
       assert self.central_api.create_zone()

You can also explicitly enable or disable the use of a transaction or
the retries.

Change-Id: If3c33940679b41bb09e0d8b92f46f757cba78e8e

added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Rackspace Hosting # # Author: Eric Larson <eric.larson@rackspace.com> # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import copy import threading import time import wrapt from oslo_utils import excutils from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_db import exception as db_exception from designate.i18n import _LW LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) ENABLE_RETRIES = True ENABLE_USE_TRANSACTION = True ENABLE_TRANSACTION = True def _retry_on_deadlock(exc): """Filter to trigger retry a when a Deadlock is received.""" # TODO(kiall): This is a total leak of the SQLA Driver, we'll need a better # way to handle this. if isinstance(exc, db_exception.DBDeadlock): LOG.warning(_LW("Deadlock detected. Retrying...")) return True return False RETRY_STATE = threading.local() def retry(cb=None, retries=50, delay=150): """A retry decorator that ignores attempts at creating nested retries""" @wrapt.decorator(enabled=ENABLE_RETRIES) def retry_wrapper(wrapped, instance, args, kwargs): if not hasattr(RETRY_STATE, 'held'): # Create the state vars if necessary RETRY_STATE.held = False RETRY_STATE.retries = 0 if not RETRY_STATE.held: # We're the outermost retry decorator RETRY_STATE.held = True try: while True: try: result = wrapped(*copy.deepcopy(args), **copy.deepcopy(kwargs)) break except Exception as exc: RETRY_STATE.retries += 1 if RETRY_STATE.retries >= retries: # Exceeded retry attempts, raise. raise elif cb is not None and cb(exc) is False: # We're not setup to retry on this exception. raise else: # Retry, with a delay. time.sleep(delay / float(1000)) finally: RETRY_STATE.held = False RETRY_STATE.retries = 0 else: # We're an inner retry decorator, just pass on through. result = wrapped(*copy.deepcopy(args), **copy.deepcopy(kwargs)) return result return retry_wrapper @wrapt.decorator(enabled=ENABLE_USE_TRANSACTION) def use_transaction(wrapped, instance, args, kwargs): instance.storage.begin() try: result = wrapped(*args, **kwargs) instance.storage.commit() return result except Exception: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): instance.storage.rollback() @wrapt.decorator(enabled=ENABLE_TRANSACTION) def transaction(wrapped, instance, args, kwargs): wrapped = use_transaction(wrapped) wrapped = retry(cb=_retry_on_deadlock)(wrapped) return wrapped(*args, **kwargs)

commit_message:
roles: bifrost-ironic-install: SUSE/Debian: Add gcc and python-pip packages

Commit c6e2851819cfc ("Fixes to allow install Ironic on remote node")
added support for installing Ironic on a remote host. It also added new
package dependencies such as python-pip and gcc but it missed the SUSE
and Debian files. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I6524db298bb559e0db138825c5c7641276855349
Fixes: c6e2851819cfc ("Fixes to allow install Ironic on remote node")

This version assumes you are # running devstack to configure the software. # # Copied: ceilometer Listen 9001 <VirtualHost *> WSGIDaemonProcess designate-api user=vagrant group=vagrant processes=2 threads=10 WSGIScriptAlias / /var/www/designate/app.wsgi SetEnv APACHE_RUN_USER vagrant SetEnv APACHE_RUN_GROUP vagrant WSGIProcessGroup designate-api ErrorLog /var/log/apache2/designate_error.log LogLevel warn CustomLog /var/log/apache2/designate_access.log combined </VirtualHost>

commit_message:
Improve logging in designate.manage

We should delegate (when possible) formatting to the logger in order to
perform formatting only when needed, by using:

LOG.<level>(message, data)

instead of:

LOG.<level>(message % data)

This change also remove oslo_log module import but unused.

Change-Id: I5ddbf3b3c5158d79decb52930a686d24b64a7107

commit_message:
Move config to avoid import issues with eventlet

In order to facilitate support for Apache support eventlet needs to be
disabled when using Apache2 for the API. But if we patch eventlet
before oslo.messaging imports threads when setting defaults for exchange
services blows up with errors due to threading not being patched etc.

We move configuration into it's own module that's imported by utils.py
which is a class used by *almost* every other service so that should be
a non-invasive change.

Change-Id: I64923c7bcade927205193051db8d4a0926c71051

commit_message:
Remove vendor_passthru mentions from lookup/heartbeat documentation

Currently, the documentation index provides the old lookup/heartbeat
URLs. Commit b033bfd9 removed usage for these URLs.

This commit replaces old URLs from docs with the ones actually used.

Change-Id: I375045c23663768e4971d76162c87b731ee82eb3
Related-bug: #1640533

commit_message:
Extended functionality to generate parameterized test cases

This change adds a function, get_param_datasets, that will add a
fuzz string dataset to each element of a list passed in. This will
allow for the generation of a fuzz test for each API parameter in
the same way that fuzz tests are generated for each payload.

Change-Id: Ibf67e53e1203187cf245e3c51b6874f46946793b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/28/211728/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_param_datasets(self, parameters, fuzz_string_types): """ Get multiple datasets for use in parameterized tests for each atttribute to be fuzzed """ result = {} for param in parameters: for fuzz_type in fuzz_string_types: strings = self.get_strings(fuzz_type) for string in strings: name = '{0}_{1}_{2}'.format( param, fuzz_type, self.get_fuzz_string_name(fuzz_type, string) ) result[name] = {'parameter': param, 'fuzz_type': fuzz_type, 'payload': string} return result

commit_message:
check is_admin before setting all_tenants in get_quotas

When users/clients without an admin token make
call to quotas API[1], it fails.
This patch modifies that by setting all_tenants
to true only for admin role.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/python-designateclient/
blob/master/designateclient/v1/quotas.py#L26

Closes-Bug: #1462428

Change-Id: I51cf606d8cb839a318661d2e5e2b46269b350bd4

commit_message:
Set is_admin during context initialization

Currently is_admin is not being set during context
initialization. This patch fixes that by setting
is_admin during context initialization based on
whether user has 'admin' role or not. So that,  is_admin
can be checked latter at any place during request flow,
and actions can be taken accordingly.

Change-Id: I8a48b6a5c0240255e8743e5c7c57aed398b39544

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/1130964dc1fba3df1e359fcd931ad6db\n'

Change-Id: Ia8bec915424f8461b27e3a58b97fe45921437fb0

commit_message:
api-ref: Fix LBaaS v1 API reference

LBaaS v1 support was removed in Newton release, but there are
still users of LBaaS v1 API. It looks reasonable to maintain it
with minimum effort rather than dropping it.
This commit fixes LBaaS v1 API document with rough checks.

Note that project_id field is not listed in LBaaS v1 API intentionally
as project_id field was added in Newton release.

Part of blueprint neutron-in-tree-api-ref

Change-Id: I82d8f00f726247eb305a6b7207ae1bd2262fe296

commit_message:
Warn about using EC with isa_l_rs_vand and nparity >= 5

We *know* there are combinations that will prevent decoding, and we're
going to be increasingly aggressive about getting it out of clusters.

Partial-Bug: 1639691
Change-Id: I50159c9d19f2385d5f60112e9aaefa1a68098313
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/96/425496/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import loggingimport sys if self._ec_type == 'isa_l_rs_vand' and self._ec_nparity >= 5: logger = logging.getLogger("swift.common.storage_policy") if not logger.handlers: # If nothing else, log to stderr logger.addHandler(logging.StreamHandler(sys.__stderr__)) logger.warning( 'Storage policy %s uses an EC configuration known to harm ' 'data durability. Any data in this policy should be migrated. ' 'See https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/1639691 for ' 'more information.' % self.name) if not is_deprecated: # TODO: To fully close bug 1639691, uncomment the raise and # removing the warning below. This will be in the Pike release # at the earliest. logger.warning( 'In a future release, this will prevent services from ' 'starting unless the policy is marked as deprecated.') # raise ValueError('Storage policy %s MUST be deprecated' % # self.name)

commit_message:
Auth Method Handlers now return a response object always

Always return a response object for an AuthMethodHandler. This
allows us to better understand success/failure states from the
Auth Handler Plugins. Instead of relying on arbitrary check of
if user_id is in the AuthContext. This is required for full MFA
support as each plugin will need to report success/failure.

bp: per-user-auth-plugin-reqs
Change-Id: I688b50f61c8a9ce90ca3e7de2471c60f588ef902

commit_message:
Add MFA Rules and Enabled User options

Add the user-options for the MFA rules and the MFA Rules enabled. This
validates and stores the option values for the MFA rule sets (list of
lists of strings, no duplicate sub-lists, no duplicate strings in sub
lists).

This does not implement validation that the strings are in-fact
auth-methods. This is just the scafolding for the user-options.

Change-Id: I64add63d9fc99bf66936913523340ee3c1290a9e
bp: per-user-auth-plugin-reqs

Use new keystoneauth1 helper

keystoneauth1 can register adapter options, use that to be
homogeneous with other cli.

Change-Id: I3b2494e8a817541002b30b2b589156ce1f78e7c2

commit_message:
Use https for references to openstack.org

The openstack.org pages now support https and our references to
the site should by default be one signed by the organization.

Change-Id: I83d2df500e2e30047494c201a2ab39820ffd1502

commit_message:
Fix exception parsing error

The JSON body from a HTTP exception may contain non-dict values.
Previous attempt to fix exception parsing is failing this case.
This patch fixes it.

Closes-Bug: #1660531
Change-Id: I560439167cf6384ef17ce429d663279502bf9b18
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/40/427040/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_map_exceptions_http_exception_handle_json_1(self): # A test for json containing non-dict values mock_resp = mock.Mock() mock_resp.status_code = 404 mock_resp.json.return_value = { "code": 404, "error": { "message": "resource not found", }, } mock_resp.headers = { "content-type": "application/json" } ksa_exc = _exceptions.HttpError(message="test", http_status=404, response=mock_resp) func = mock.Mock(side_effect=ksa_exc) os_exc = self._assert_map_exceptions( exceptions.HttpException, ksa_exc, func) self.assertIn('not found', os_exc.details)

commit_message:
Heat extension is located in the entrypoints section but not in the
packages one

  In case of building an RPM package for stable/newton, this will
  cause troubles.

Change-Id: I35077318dd8ba16cd10ad2edb8c424865cbf55db
Signed-off-by: Ricardo Noriega <rnoriega@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Display Role tag when role is not available

In case when Role the Node is tagged to does not exist in current
Plan, display the tag instead of 'Not Assigned'

Closes-Bug: 1644801
Change-Id: I3f098491734509be8cd075e989207ff370d8dd74

commit_message:
Add information to QSG about reliance on kolla-ansible

kolla-ansible is required to generate configuration data.  Tell operators
and develoeprs that, so they may take a look at kolla-kubernetes.

Change-Id: I77132f973e68465420bbdc67bab318a5c704ca1d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/84/420384/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Install Kolla-Ansible ===================== The kolla-ansible delivery is a required dependency for generating the default configuration consumed by kolla-kubernetes. This is a short-term development solution. The medium term solution (Prior to May 2017) is to entirely remove genconfig from the system and all reliance kolla-ansible as a dependency such that kolla-kubernetes stands alone as a Kolla deliverable. While the community solves the above problemInstall kolla-ansible: :: sudo pip install kolla-ansible sudo kolla-genpwd sudo kolla-ansible genconfig
deleted_lines: pushd kolla sudo ./tools/generate_passwords.py sudo ./tools/kolla-ansible genconfig popd

added_lines: A new options have been made available via the user create and update API (``POST/PATCH /v3/users) call, the options will allow an admin to mark users as exempt from certain PCI requirements via an API. Set the following user attributes to ``True`` or ``False`` in an API request. To mark a user as exempt from the PCI password lockout policy:: user['options']['ignore_lockout_failure_attempts'] To mark a user as exempt from the PCI password expiry policy:: user['options']['ignore_password_expiry'] To mark a user as exempt from the PCI reset policy:: user['options']['ignore_change_password_upon_first_use']
deleted_lines: A new option has been made available via the user create and update API (``POST/PATCH /v3/users) call, the option will allow an admin to mark users as exempt from the PCI password expiry policy via an API. This can be done like so: ``user['options']['ignore_password_expiry']``.

commit_message:
Create user option `ignore_lockout_failure_attempts`

Rather than an option list in keystone.conf, leverage the
per-user options available via REST APIs, to define whether
a user is exempt from being disabled upon too many failed
password attempts.

Closes-Bug: 1659995

Co-Authored-By: "Steve Martinelli <s.martinelli@gmail.com>"
Change-Id: I6999343314a9e11a82664cd0db6e56047084fa76
