commit_message:
Add release notes for Ocata-3

Change-Id: Ifaee95bea9ead68d4c6d8796c49918034fa373c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/07/426807/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: features: - Add zaqar.use_websockets option to os-collect-config. - Add scripts to zero iptables & ip6tables files at build time. When including these new elements, we empty the stock /etc/sysconfig/iptables and /etc/sysconfig/ip6tables filse as shipped by the iptables rpm package. The reason for this is that puppet firewall has a hard time to cope with exiting rules when these files are populated and the iptables service is not active. - Add element to customize dracut on the agent. Updates the ironic agent, installing multipath package and regenerating dracut to add all the specified drivers. - Add element to rebuild dracut enabling modules To support TripleO whole disk images (with enabled security), we need lvm and crypt modules. So creating that element in TripleO, that will install the needed packages, and will rebuild the image to add the modules we need. fixes: - Purge Chrony package in NTP element. If NTP is installed and used, make sure Chrony is not installed because they would conflict each others. - Fixes `bug 1659493 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1659493>__ so we don't fail on building the IPA ramdisk, by setting IRONIC_AGENT_MULTIPATH_DRIVERS to empty when undefined. other: - Copy map-services script to tripleo elements. map-services will be removed on dib v2 branch, but TripleO still relies heavily on it. To prevent breakage, copy the script to the internal element using it. In the future, all elements will need to be migrated to new svc-map, but it is a massive change.

commit_message:
VMAX driver - storage group cleanup on error

If the create volume operation fails at the
create_volume_from_sg stage, the cinder driver should clean
up the created Storage Group if there are no other volumes
present.

Change-Id: I0f5b07234fa7ceb3ab04b5daf87754391bbb2e98
Closes-Bug: #1649962

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove python-climateclient.

Change-Id: I48d55899c999f56d4a018aff9a10d50c336dd483

This patch fixes the code to make latest flake8 happy.
Changes:

1. There is no xrange in python3. Import range from
   six.moves or simply use range from builtins, where
   number of iterations is fixed and small.
2. Don't use unicode and long. There are six.text_type,
   six.string_types and six.integer_types to avoid it.
3. Replace 'file' with 'open'.

   (f = lambda (x, y): x += y; f((1,2))).

commit_message:
Fix syntax for python3

This patch fixes the code to make latest flake8 happy.
Changes:

1. There is no xrange in python3. Import range from
   six.moves or simply use range from builtins, where
   number of iterations is fixed and small.
2. Don't use unicode and long. There are six.text_type,
   six.string_types and six.integer_types to avoid it.
3. Replace 'file' with 'open'.
4. You can't put function argument into tuple directly
   (f = lambda (x, y): x += y; f((1,2))).

Cherry-picked from 665eed4e569b800f537f67514a0236972cbdb167

Change-Id: I7c8c8a27378f6b74623056a338243f58c5c0209a

deleted_lines: for i in xrange(2): for i in xrange(2):

commit_message:
Plugin management code was moved from fuelclient to nailgun.

Nailgun now has its own plugins packet manager.

Added new API endpoint:
  /plugins/upload

Added new commands:
  fuel2 plugins install
  fuel2 plugins remove

Removed old command:
  fuel plugins

Partial-Bug: 1504338
Partial-Bug: 1562466 (https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1562466)
Change-Id: I88810a30f9630de14b9ed5eb56e425121a555f6b

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-fuelclient refs/changes/88/335488/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os import re from cliff import argparse from fuelclient import utilsclass PluginsInstall(PluginsMixIn, base.BaseCommand): """Install, upgrade or downgrade plugin and register it in API service.""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(PluginsInstall, self).get_parser(prog_name) def _plugin_file(path): if not utils.file_exists(path): raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError( 'File "{0}" does not exists'.format(path)) return path parser.add_argument( 'path', type=_plugin_file, help='Path to plugin file') parser.add_argument( '--force', action='store_true', help='Used for reinstall or downgrade a plugin') return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): result = self.client.install(parsed_args.path, force=parsed_args.force) self.app.stdout.write("Plugin '{0}' was successfully {1}.\n".format( os.path.basename(parsed_args.path), result.get('action'))) class PluginsRemove(PluginsMixIn, base.BaseCommand): """Remove plugin from file system and from API service.""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(PluginsRemove, self).get_parser(prog_name) def _plugin_attrs(string): attrs = string.split('==') if len(attrs) != 2 or not re.search('^\d+\.\d+\.\d+$', attrs[1]): raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError( "wrong format. Please set it as 'fuel_plugin==1.0.0'") return attrs parser.add_argument( 'plugin', type=_plugin_attrs, help="Plugin to remove in format 'name==version'") return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): self.client.remove(*parsed_args.plugin) self.app.stdout.write( "Plugin '{0}=={1}' was successfully removed.\n".format( *parsed_args.plugin))

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove os-api-ref.

Change-Id: I7ad1c2afda29b095ff3d53db5eec7101f8816c2e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-api-ref refs/changes/10/413310/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Revert "Add ID property to all entities"

This change breaks several gates, including RDO's package promotion.

This reverts commit f06ba481956d406a1edf644f1c2c3ff55705d0f1.

Change-Id: I0524b7057016daa59ea0a506bdc50a71e9fc8f6a

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded components

We can use ${DIB_DEBIAN_COMPONENTS} to get this information. We also
already set the mirror.

Change-Id: Idd11c2b7df1d247c6d32a5f936b8601b4741b519
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: allow any binding for vncserver_listen

This change in Nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/73428/

... means that we no longer need to restrict vncserver_listen parameter
to be configured on a certain binding.

Remove this restriction so deployments can set the compute IP instead of
0.0.0.0.

Closes-Bug: #1660099
Change-Id: I3fa050f94f9c95221bb71e16c70ad9128f8684dc
(cherry picked from commit 14129857431f78d5c25dbd71b5682c9cd789ae1a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/98/426898/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: include ::nova::migration::libvirt
deleted_lines: if $vncserver_listen != '0.0.0.0' and $vncserver_listen != '::0' { fail('For migration support to work, you MUST set vncserver_listen to \'0.0.0.0\' or \'::0\'') } else { include ::nova::migration::libvirt }

commit_message:
Add control_exchange and rpc_response_timeout options

Add control_exchange to configure an exchange name for message.
Add rpc_response_timeout to configure seconds time for waiting
for a response from a call.

Change-Id: I0d54accfea048fa394dac18e141a620d127579cf

commit_message:
Add the start scripts of processmonitor and hostmonitor

This patch adds the start scripts of masakari-processmonitor
and masakari-hostmonitor.

Change-Id: I40eea294aafc96c44b197401fba08ac3cdfe5f9e
Closes-Bug: #1655844

commit_message:
Fix keystone endpoint creation defaults.

This ps sets the -admin and -public endnpoints to be different
by default.

Co-Authored-By: Serguei Bezverkhi <sbezverk@cisco.com>

Change-Id: I9ab573a0eeef537478c078d3df98af8bf064bffa

commit_message:
Switch to decorators.idempotent_id

test.idempotent_id is being kept temporary to migrate
to new lib interface. Now idempotent_id is available as Tempest stable
interface decorators and all plugins tests using the old decorator
should be switched to new interface.

In future, Once all plugins are switched to new decorator Tempest
will remove the test.idempotent_id

Change-Id: Idf6d897fe1e4c3658f45f291dc478d8dff867628
Related-Bug: 1616913

commit_message:
Run the placement service when upgrading to Ocata

Now the placement service is mandatory in Ocata, we need to modify Grenade
to deploy that service even if the source local.conf is not providing it.

Note that we need to do this as part of nova right now because the
code for placement is in the nova tree. If we do it before and separately,
we end up starting a newton placement service, which is not enough for
ocata nova (and/or we partially upgrade nova from 55_placement, which
breaks within-$release and my brain).

Change-Id: I573149b9415da2a8bb3951a4c4ce71c4c3e48c6f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/30/424730/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: source $TARGET_DEVSTACK_DIR/lib/placement # Make sure we enable the Placement API before rolling out Ocata since it's # now mandatory. stack_install_service placement cleanup_placement configure_placement configure_placement_nova_compute

commit_message:
tempest: configure compute-feature-enabled.swap_volume if libvirt

The only virt driver in nova that supports the swap volume API is
libvirt so enable testing that in Tempest only if using libvirt.

Depends on two changes:

1. The Tempest change that adds the new config option and test.

Depends-On: I2d4779de8d21aa84533f4f92d347e932db2de58e

2. A nova fix for correctly waiting for the block copy job in the guest
   to complete.

Depends-On: I0c52917a5555a70c4973f37dea1aebf878dd73b4

Change-Id: Ibb6b309574d2c6a06fcecb0626ea21527fb7f412

commit_message:
Gate fix 4

This PS changes the permissions on the built images so that the
tarballs.openstack.org site will allow them to be downloaded.
Also uploads both 2.x and 3.x containers.

Change-Id: Ice85b3a4efe0c17e6949fb3e5a7fb944109ed0cf

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-31 00:05:36.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/kubernetes_api.py', 'conf.d/cadvisor.yaml.example', 'kubernetes/kubernetes_daemon_set.yml', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/cadvisor.py', 'kubernetes/README.md', 'docker-agent/README.md', 'docker-agent/kubernetes_api.yaml', 'docker-agent/kubernetes_get_host.py', 'Dockerfile', 'conf.d/kubernetes.yaml.example', 'docker-agent/kubernetes.yaml', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks/utils.py', 'docker-agent/docker.yaml', 'docs/DeveloperDocs/agent_internals.md', 'docs/Plugins.md', 'docker-agent/docker.sh', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/kubernetes.py', 'conf.d/kubernetes_api.yaml.example', 'kubernetes/kubernetes_api.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent/commit/9ef70ba11476ffc96a8912dd7efc903aaf506da1', 'message': 'Add monitoring for kubernetes environment

Adds there plugins

Kubernetes plugin to monitor pod and container level metrics.
Meant to be run on each kubernetes node.

Kubernetes api plugin to collect metrics about the kubernetes
deployment from the Kuberentes API.

cAdvisor plugin for monitoring kubernetes hosts

Dockerfile and directions for creating a docker image for the

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/381967/, written by
Tim Buckley <timothy.jas.buckley@hpe.com>

Add kubernetes configurations. One for creating a deamonset
agent that monitors each kubernetes node. And the other for
creating a deployment that monitors the kubernetes api.

Change-Id: I070df01df7c987df73041d7d192ef78bb9f5b3df
'}]
commit_message:
Add monitoring for kubernetes environment

Adds there plugins

Kubernetes plugin to monitor pod and container level metrics.
Meant to be run on each kubernetes node.

Kubernetes api plugin to collect metrics about the kubernetes
deployment from the Kuberentes API.

cAdvisor plugin for monitoring kubernetes hosts

Dockerfile and directions for creating a docker image for the
agent and how to run it. Taken from the review
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/381967/, written by
Tim Buckley <timothy.jas.buckley@hpe.com>

Add kubernetes configurations. One for creating a deamonset
agent that monitors each kubernetes node. And the other for
creating a deployment that monitors the kubernetes api.

Change-Id: I070df01df7c987df73041d7d192ef78bb9f5b3df

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-pacemaker refs/changes/13/310713/21 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # @return [Array<Hash>] list of hashes for pcmk_resource. def pcs_resource_parse(lines)
deleted_lines: # @return [Array<Hash>,nil] list of hashes for pcmk_resource. Nil if empty. def pcs_resource_parse_master(lines) return nil if parsed.empty?

subject: Rspec code to test mangle output for keystone_user
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-28 18:09:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/da6f52b4411bc55a78b3d06627ac7fcb233f6d71', 'message': 'Rspec code to test mangle output for keystone_user

This make sure that we retrieve the user even when the output is mangled
with warning from the cli.

Change-Id: Ia798f9b5ec88f1bdfda340076856086bc513486f
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-28 18:11:58.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/provider/keystone_user/openstack_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_user/openstack.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/31cd0a91c4473fc228b9c808de01919afdf40116', 'message': 'Rspec code to test mangle output for keystone_user

This make sure that we retrieve the user even when the output is mangled
with warning from the cli.

Change-Id: Ia798f9b5ec88f1bdfda340076856086bc513486f
'}]
commit_message:
Rspec code to test mangle output for keystone_user

This make sure that we retrieve the user even when the output is mangled
with warning from the cli.

Change-Id: Ia798f9b5ec88f1bdfda340076856086bc513486f

commit_message:
WIP: idea to implement user facing timeout.

Test a way to implement user facing timeout configuration.  Very early
stage, not got for review.

Change-Id: I4069faed3ac07799422f57132dd454b3a4f1de21
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/11/334011/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: old_command_timeout = '' begin if resource[:command_timeout] old_command_timeout = self.class.class_variable_get("@@command_timeout") self.class.class_variable_set("@@command_timeout", resource[:command_timeout]) Puppet.debug("Setting command timeout to #{resource[:command_timeout]}") end case @property_flush[:enabled] when :true options << '--enable' when :false options << '--disable' end (options << "--description=#{resource[:description]}") if @property_flush[:description] self.class.request('project', 'set', [id] + options) unless options.empty? ensure if resource[:command_timeout] self.class.class_variable_set("@@command_timeout", old_command_timeout) Puppet.debug("Restoring command timeout to #{old_command_timeout}") end
deleted_lines: case @property_flush[:enabled] when :true options << '--enable' when :false options << '--disable' (options << "--description=#{resource[:description]}") if @property_flush[:description] self.class.request('project', 'set', [id] + options) unless options.empty?

commit_message:
Move nova constraints to tripleo-puppet.

This moves all nova constraints into puppet-tripleo.  It really helps
with the refactor aiming at using the new resources in the latest
version of the pacemaker puppet module.

Change-Id: I1e9affc91f6a3e180c065f8fbaa622806e4e4cfb
Depends-on: I201763ffa349bf9c67228554d1b78e73075b7441

commit_message:
Move nova constraint, and refactor its declaration

This moves all nova constraints into puppet-tripleo.

Furthermore it introduces a new define to ease the declaration of the
constraints which will avoid hard to debug bugs like the one this patch
relates to.

It also adds the necessary structure to make spec on define.

Furthermore, when the refactoring of services will happen this will make
it easier to remove/adjust them.

Eventually, this really help a lot for the refactor related to the new
resource in the pacemaker module.

Change-Id: I201763ffa349bf9c67228554d1b78e73075b7441
Related-Bug: 1592776
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/69/332069/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # == Define: tripleo::pacemaker::pseudo_group # # Pacemaker groups are not used in the pacemaker configuration, only # order and colocation. In order for the resources to not be started # elsewhere by pacemaker this pattern requires that resources form a # "group": order and colocation to infinity. # # This creates this kind of tree # http://acksyn.org/files/tripleo/wsgi-openstack-core.pdf # # === Parameters: # # [*first*] # (String) First resource in order and target in colocation # Required # # [*second*] # (String) Second resource in order and source in colocation # Required # # [*order_name*] # (String) Name of the order resource. # Required # # [*colocation_name*] # (String) Name of the colocation resource. # Required define tripleo::pacemaker::pseudo_group ( $first, $second, $order_name, $colocation_name, ) { validate_string($first) validate_string($second) validate_string($order_name) validate_string($colocation_name) if empty($first) or empty($second) or empty($order_name) or empty($colocation_name) { fail 'All parameters should be set!' } pacemaker::constraint::base { $order_name: constraint_type => 'order', first_resource => "${first}-clone", second_resource => "${second}-clone", first_action => 'start', second_action => 'start', } pacemaker::constraint::colocation { $colocation_name: source => "${second}-clone", target => "${first}-clone", score => 'INFINITY', } # Dependencies. if $first == 'openstack-core' { Pacemaker::Resource::Ocf['openstack-core'] -> Pacemaker::Constraint::Base[$order_name] Pacemaker::Resource::Ocf['openstack-core'] -> Pacemaker::Constraint::Colocation[$colocation_name] } else { Pacemaker::Resource::Service[$first] -> Pacemaker::Constraint::Base[$order_name] Pacemaker::Resource::Service[$first] -> Pacemaker::Constraint::Colocation[$colocation_name] } Pacemaker::Resource::Service[$second] -> Pacemaker::Constraint::Base[$order_name] Pacemaker::Resource::Service[$second] -> Pacemaker::Constraint::Colocation[$colocation_name] }

subject: Add one deployment per user on one server.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 10:56:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/d51c96c1a8f73618c5a9d04d70f0df077fd41145', 'message': "Add one deployment per user on one server.

With this it's now possible to deploy multiple tripleo on the same
server using this kind of command:

    ./quickstart.sh  --working-dir $HOME/.quickstack-ha \
        -c config/general_config/ha.yml \
        --extra-vars non_root_user=stackha $VIRTHOST

There can be an transition problem as the bridge's name are changing.

Change-Id: I6db32b0ef34549a2d087129521343ded5a0c3361
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-17 11:34:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/bfaecea7990d4c3198419be9eba8c592c285f497', 'message': "Add one deployment per user on one server.

With this it's now possible to deploy multiple tripleo on the same
server using this kind of command:

    ./quickstart.sh  --working-dir $HOME/.quickstack-ha \
        -c config/general_config/ha.yml \
        --extra-vars non_root_user=stackha $VIRTHOST

commit_message:
Add one deployment per user on one server.

With this it's now possible to deploy multiple tripleo on the same
server using this kind of command:

    ./quickstart.sh  --working-dir $HOME/.quickstack-ha \
        -c config/general_config/ha.yml \
        --extra-vars 'non_root_user=stackha external_network_cidr=192.168.24.0/24' \
        $VIRTHOST

There can be an transition problem as the bridge's name are changing.
To fix it you delete the old name scheme environment using those
commands:

    su - stack
    virsh list --uuid | xargs -n 1 virsh destroy
    virsh list --all --uuid | xargs -n 1 virsh undefine --remove-all-storage
    sudo virsh net-destroy external
    sudo virsh net-undefine external
    sudo virsh net-destroy overcloud
    sudo virsh net-undefine overcloud

Change-Id: I6db32b0ef34549a2d087129521343ded5a0c3361
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/45/331045/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: bridge: "{{non_root_user}}_brext" bridge: "{{non_root_user}}_brovc" ovs_bridge: "{{non_root_user}}_br-ctlplane"
deleted_lines: bridge: brext bridge: brovc ovs_bridge: br-ctlplane

commit_message:
WIP: integration of the new puppet pacemaker.

The new puppet pacemaker module resulting of the merge of the fuel and
redhat puppet-pacemaker offer a lot of new functionality.

This is currently in very early (non-working) stage. In a effort to
integrate the new interface and refactore this module accordingly.

Change-Id: Ibb6dc377305fe5381100ce64200d01a1b5f4202a
Depends-On: Iab6de04c9a6b14866e6ee14b3faf96216c84913f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/69/309069/39 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pcmk_order { "${vip_name}_vip-then-haproxy": first => "ip-${ip_address}", second => 'haproxy-clone', kind => 'optional', } pcmk_colocation { "${vip_name}_vip-with-haproxy": first => "ip-${ip_address}", second => 'haproxy-clone',
deleted_lines: pacemaker::constraint::base { "${vip_name}_vip-then-haproxy": constraint_type => 'order', first_resource => "ip-${ip_address}", second_resource => 'haproxy-clone', first_action => 'start', second_action => 'start', constraint_params => 'kind=Optional', require => [Pacemaker::Resource::Service['haproxy'], Pacemaker::Resource::Ip["${vip_name}_vip"]], } pacemaker::constraint::colocation { "${vip_name}_vip-with-haproxy": source => "ip-${ip_address}", target => 'haproxy-clone', score => 'INFINITY', require => [Pacemaker::Resource::Service['haproxy'], Pacemaker::Resource::Ip["${vip_name}_vip"]],

subject: WIP: integration of the new puppet pacemaker.

commit_message:
WIP: integration of the new puppet pacemaker.

The new puppet pacemaker module resulting of the merge of the fuel and
redhat puppet-pacemaker offer a lot of new functionality.

This is currently in very early (non-working) stage.  In a effort to
integrate the new interface and refactore this module accordingly.

Depends-On: Iab6de04c9a6b14866e6ee14b3faf96216c84913f
Depends-On: Ibb6dc377305fe5381100ce64200d01a1b5f4202a
Change-Id: I6e74a90223f599eb93a46f9bba72763a6a54c4e2

commit_message:
modernise gabbi tests

gabbi 1.7 supports defining url+method in a single line to make
syntax less verbose and more specific.

Change-Id: Ib9ee3a26d634aab0a3f123932996e3a4835b9814

commit_message:
tests: do not create a resource with a custom resource type in 2.2

This actually creates a resource whose id is "" since $RESOURCE_ID_EXT is
empty.

Change-Id: I10c797dfb356de9707e17a3871af53235f576798

subject: mysql: retry on table changes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-26 21:40:58.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/indexer/sqlalchemy.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi/commit/fc0e38c1dea9894e56bb7995f44cf29c138db034', 'message': 'mysql: retry on table changes

As seen in the backtrace from 0d268f5df8a5b82f3bfe1128a5043131da956bb9, MySQL
now wants us to retry if the table definition changes.

Change-Id: Ib8552529e73cee4ea92c151bbe3b9879e93a3a7c
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>
'}]
commit_message:
mysql: retry on table changes

As seen in the backtrace from 0d268f5df8a5b82f3bfe1128a5043131da956bb9, MySQL
now wants us to retry if the table definition changes.

Change-Id: Ib8552529e73cee4ea92c151bbe3b9879e93a3a7c
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/38/425938/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _retry_on_exceptions(exc): return ( pymysql and isinstance(exc, exception.DBError) and isinstance(exc.inner_exception, sqlalchemy.exc.InternalError) and isinstance(exc.inner_exception.orig, pymysql.err.InternalError) and (exc.inner_exception.orig.args[0] == pymysql.constants.ER.TABLE_DEF_CHANGED) ) max_retry_interval=2, exception_checker=_retry_on_exceptions)(f)

subject: Make Key Pairs tab a panel under Compute
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 17:56:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/7171d8569047f15ef6542b3705020f7ed63dd469', 'message': 'Make Key Pairs tab a panel under Compute

As part of the breaking up of Access and Security, move the Key Pairs
tab to a new panel under Compute. Separate patches will address Floating
IPs, Security Groups, and API Access.

Fixes include:
- Should be significantly faster to access Key Pairs, as we are no
longer running multiple API calls for the other Access & Security tabs
at the same time. Hooray for speed!
- Should be easier for new users to find where Key Pairs are located.

commit_message:
Make Key Pairs tab a panel under Compute

As part of the breaking up of Access and Security, move the Key Pairs
tab to a new panel under Compute. Separate patches will address Floating
IPs, Security Groups, and API Access.

Fixes include:
- Should be significantly faster to access Key Pairs, as we are no
longer running multiple API calls for the other Access & Security tabs
at the same time. Hooray for speed!
- Should be easier for new users to find where Key Pairs are located.
- Reduce reuse of identical translatable strings
- Use common templates instead of duplication
- Updated policy rules and added missing rules to table get_data
- Small cleanup of the Key Pair download page, which was previously
using modal classes despite not being a modal.

Change-Id: I66f1f65a2cb49bd10e0364b12efba4346f373ed3
Implements: blueprint reorganise-access-and-security

commit_message:
Correct the package name

Now the murano-pkg-check gives the error:
Exception: Versioning for this project requires either an sdist tarball,
or access to an upstream git repository. Are you sure that git is installed?
This patch correct the package name when get the package version.

Change-Id: I33500b3527e21a513f9130f55f0b54ba0e047d5f
Closes-Bug: #1653060

commit_message:
WIP: Agent rescue implementation

TODO: Properly use boot driver to boot ramdisk
TODO: ensure network actions are safe (i.e. unconf'ing network ports
      won't permanently break anything)
TODO: testing

Change-Id: I4fa60d68556858e6f9ba8b632161fa7324d129f2
Related-bug: #1526449

agent.AgentRescue() n = { 'driver': 'fake_agent', 'instance_info': INSTANCE_INFO, 'driver_info': DRIVER_INFO } self.node = object_utils.create_test_node(self.context, **n) self.port = commit_message:
Add control_exchange and rpc_response_timeout options

Add control_exchange to configure an exchange name for message.
Add rpc_response_timeout to configure seconds time for waiting
for a response from a call.

Change-Id: I6af5d82837eecd7d56649bbd355985f125800588
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cloudkitty refs/changes/70/426470/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*rpc_response_timeout*] # (Optional) Seconds to wait for a response from a call. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*control_exchange*] # (Optional) The default exchange under which topics are scoped. May be # overridden by an exchange name specified in the transport_url # option. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # $rpc_response_timeout = $::os_service_default, $control_exchange = $::os_service_default, transport_url => $default_transport_url, rpc_response_timeout => $rpc_response_timeout, control_exchange => $control_exchange,

commit_message:
Multi-domain testing with ldap backend.

Install a complete and working multi-domains (sql and LDAP backend) and
associated functional testing.

The LDAP server is based on OpenLDAP, and the mapping is done again
inetOrgPerson.  It's basic and doesn't support role.  The user password
and the enable parameter are non-functional (they are written but not
red back properly).  This is however enough to test that the
multi-domain configuration is working.

After the test, the keystone server is reset to its nominal, non
multi-domain configuration, to let other functional works correctly.

This also removes the "expected to be non-working puppet apply" beaker
tests of the keystone_domain_config, which has raised so many questions
on the irc channel.

Change-Id: I66e36b8027adf572ad6518dc868b7fa722bfc830
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/70/296370/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper_acceptance' describe 'keystone server running with domain-specific backend (LDAD)' do describe 'install necessary requirements for test' do install_dev_puppet_module(:module_name => 'camptocamp-openldap') end end

commit_message:
WIP Support for erasure code in swift

Introducting storage policies here, will split them
out into their own review before this merges.

Closes-Bug: #1554835

Change-Id: Ifd6505db7fec63c168aa36de879bafda6589596c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/66/264966/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [ *ec* ] # (optional) Setting ec to true will configure the # swift-object-reconstructor section in the object-server # config file. Used for erasure coding support. ## [*reconstructor_concurrency*] # (optional) Number of reconstructor workers to spawn. # Defaults to $::processorcount. # $devices = '/srv/node', $owner = 'swift', $group = 'swift', $incoming_chmod = 'Du=rwx,g=rx,o=rx,Fu=rw,g=r,o=r', $outgoing_chmod = 'Du=rwx,g=rx,o=rx,Fu=rw,g=r,o=r', $max_connections = 25, $pipeline = ["${type}-server"], $mount_check = true, $user = 'swift', $workers = '1', $allow_versions = false, $ec = false, $replicator_concurrency = $::processorcount, $updater_concurrency = $::processorcount, $reaper_concurrency = $::processorcount, $reconstructor_concurrency = $::processorcount, $log_facility = 'LOG_LOCAL2', $log_level = 'INFO', $log_address = '/dev/log', $log_name = "${type}-server", $log_udp_host = undef, $log_udp_port = undef, $log_requests = true, $config_file_path = "${type}-server.conf", if $ec && ${type} { concat::fragment { "swift-${type}-${name}": target => "/etc/swift/swift.conf", content => template("swift/object-reconstructor.conf.erb"), order => '00', require => Package['swift'], }

commit_message:
Update and add haht rule test cases for locking

Conflicting* rules sent to different PE's immediately rejected
without wait.

Also allow unofficial support for sqlite /w replicated_policy_engine

*duplicate, recursion, schema mismatch

Change-Id: I9c634db3c2eddb374914f34dc53a2574f0880461

everything else.

commit_message:
Run nova manage cell_v2 discover_host after ironic nodes are registered

Once cell_v2 is enabled by default in Ocata we will need to run this command
to update the host mappings whenever a new host is added.

Change-Id: I0bb98bfcf0c271ae3b577ca126dd3dfdaece179e
Depends-On: I591b451197dc3bd0783978f5e3d2b1c830afe54e
Related-Bug: #1649341

commit_message:
Removed percona from ubuntu repos

16.04 provides the percona-xtrabackup scripts in the main repos, so the
specific percona repo can be removed. Unfortunately, mariadb10.0 does
not build with galera built-in. So until ubuntu packages mariadb10.1,
we will be dependant on the external repos for mariadb with galera
built in.

Labels keys so they are easily identified in the future. In Jinja2 the
comments cannot go inline while generating the list.

Change-Id: I5e6c2f884c8d59bbc574b71ac731d1b4db18b68c

commit_message:
Migrate -platform- devstack jobs to -neutron-full-

This is a preparatory step to make centos job voting, and to expose it
into integrated gate. As a side effect, we also get rid of a redundant
job template.

Change-Id: Ic884fac2ebd8840c88a2cad24b331073236b7045

subject: use hyphen-less option name sql_expire_sample_only
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 14:33:32.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/__init__.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/ab84fc01a4647e177cc032f77704c6f4cca82d8d', 'message': 'use hyphen-less option name sql_expire_sample_only

One storage option defined as "sql-expire-sample-only", which
causes, when execute "ceilometer-upgrade", will get the
warning: Configuration option(s) 'sql_expire_samples_only' not
supported.

This is because sql_expire_sample_only is defined in ceilometer,
not oslo db. This option should be excluded before init database
session. Please refer to the similar situation in the commit:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/249921/1

In this change, update this option name to hyphen-less, to make
sure this option correctly excluded from cfg.CONF.database options.

Change-Id: Id2afe59ca9a7ab402c1df3a80fba6e715c64eb14
(cherry picked from commit a697f13113bd0dfc087d1ac505eb25d41f0fdc47)
'}]
commit_message:
use hyphen-less option name sql_expire_sample_only

One storage option defined as "sql-expire-sample-only", which
causes, when execute "ceilometer-upgrade", will get the
warning: Configuration option(s) 'sql_expire_samples_only' not
supported.

This is because sql_expire_sample_only is defined in ceilometer,
not oslo db. This option should be excluded before init database
session. Please refer to the similar situation in the commit:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/249921/1

In this change, update this option name to hyphen-less, to make
sure this option correctly excluded from cfg.CONF.database options.

Change-Id: Id2afe59ca9a7ab402c1df3a80fba6e715c64eb14
(cherry picked from commit a697f13113bd0dfc087d1ac505eb25d41f0fdc47)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/77/409177/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Improve validation of supported QoS rules

New way of validation of QoS policy can be applied on port/network based on
port_types. It can validate if port can support rule by rule_type and also by
rule parameters or some values of parameters.

In ML2 core plugin it base on vif_type and/or vnic type for unbound
ports. For example bandwidth_limit_rule can have parameter "direction" with
possible values "ingress" and "egress". Some of mechanism drivers can support
only one of those directions.

If user will try to apply policy with rule unsupported by port_type then it
will get error message and policy will not be applied.
Such validation is made during:
* port create
* port update
* network update
* QoS rule create
* QoS rule update

Co-Authored-By: Miguel Angel Ajo <majopela@redhat.com>

Implements blueprint qos-rules-validation
Closes-Bug: #1586056
Change-Id: I293b09934a08b7af803d674f7eeea963a078acdd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/94/319694/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: supported_qos_rule_types = { qos_consts.RULE_TYPE_BANDWIDTH_LIMIT: { "direction": ["ingress", "egress"] }, # empty dict of parameters means that it supports all parameters for # this rule: qos_consts.RULE_TYPE_DSCP_MARK: {} }

commit_message:
Fixes ovs bonding option

Default ovs bonding options parameter BondInterfaceOvsOptions was wrongly set to "mode=active-backup" which makes os-net-config fail. This fix changes it to "bond_mode=active-backup".

Change-Id: If3eaac6558c1a15ac09b198f90f05f1a77cf794b
Closes-Bug: #1576137
(cherry picked from commit 75f662850a4c4e327270ad1f8291530d37e28328)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/45/426945/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: BondInterfaceOvsOptions: "bond_mode=active-backup"

commit_message:
Remove compatibility with old bash-based introspection ramdisk

Inspector is using inventory directly, so we can remove the bits sending
processed network and scheduling properties.

Change-Id: I6c58bc3c5ea78fd2dbda82b38515f332ce2e8d4a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/71/417871/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- other: - | Introspection data no longer contains keys used for compatibility with the old introspection ramdisk.

commit_message:
Fixes ovs bonding option

Default ovs bonding options parameter BondInterfaceOvsOptions was wrongly set to "mode=active-backup" which makes os-net-config fail. This fix changes it to "bond_mode=active-backup".

Change-Id: If3eaac6558c1a15ac09b198f90f05f1a77cf794b
Closes-Bug: #1576137
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/32/310732/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Stop/mask firewalld on hosts

CentOS 7 systems have firewalld installed and running by default. It's
a good service, but it has some complex firewall rules that break
neutron and some LXC networking.

This patch stops firewalld, masks the systemd unit, and then clears
iptables/ip6tables.

Closes-Bug: 1657518
Change-Id: I5ba658ee036440ed16f727e2760c0241ac76f728
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts refs/changes/57/422657/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- # Copyright 2017, Rackspace US, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. - name: Check to see if firewall-cmd exists stat: path: /usr/bin/firewall-cmd register: firewall_cmd_stat # If rc == 0, firewalld is running. If rc == 252, firewalld is stopped. - name: Check firewalld status command: /usr/bin/firewall-cmd --state register: firewalld_status failed_when: firewalld_status.rc not in [0, 252] when: - firewall_cmd_stat.stat.exists - name: Stop the firewalld service and mask it systemd: name: firewalld state: stopped masked: yes register: firewalld_mask when: - firewall_cmd_stat.stat.exists - firewalld_status.rc == 0 - name: Clear iptables rules after stopping firewalld command: "{{ item }}" with_items: - iptables -F - ip6tables -F when: - firewall_cmd_stat.stat.exists - firewalld_status.rc == 0 - firewalld_mask | changed

commit_message:
Rely on greatherthan filter from upstream jinja

The new `greaterthan` filter merged into jinja2 2.9 and it is ready
to use! This patch adjusts the tasks to use the new filter.

Closes-Bug: 1660060

commit_message:
Must not go underneath the context object and access __dict__

We have moved properties that no longer make directly accessing
the __dict__ a good practice to go forward with (because those
properties redirect to other members) so prefer to go through
the correct conversion method to get at the dict that represents
a context.

Change-Id: I6fbf2192f477f62b1843321d2ec2147a3536a888
(cherry picked from commit 1640564dd15bda135ea37be3b76d5ae0ac28b7bc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log refs/changes/87/426587/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: libvirt: Mock is_job_complete in test_driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-25 11:27:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/01957592075eba2432027915747ae836f7f30413', 'message': "libvirt: Mock is_job_complete in test_driver

Various tests were modelling the return of blockJobInfo rather than
mocking guest.BlockDevice.is_job_complete. While I'm generally very
much in favour of this kind of functional testing, distributing it
throughout individual tests is not maintainable. If we're going to do
this we need to maintain a minimal simulation library, which we don't
have.

This change updates all tests which use the return of blockJobInfo to
implicitly affect the return of is_job_complete. This allows us to
fix is_job_complete without breaking a large number of tests.

Change-Id: I676d28759da55ce678572fee135d55468dbe6a41
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Mock is_job_complete in test_driver

Various tests were modelling the return of blockJobInfo rather than
mocking guest.BlockDevice.is_job_complete. While I'm generally very
much in favour of this kind of functional testing, distributing it
throughout individual tests is not maintainable. If we're going to do
this we need to maintain a minimal simulation library, which we don't
have.

This change updates all tests which use the return of blockJobInfo to
implicitly affect the return of is_job_complete. This allows us to
fix is_job_complete without breaking a large number of tests.

Change-Id: I676d28759da55ce678572fee135d55468dbe6a41

commit_message:
Set upper constraint for jinja2

The upper constraint for jinja2 was set to 2.8.1 to avoid some
bugs in >=2.9.0,<=2.9.4. Version 2.9.5 is now available and it fixes
the bugs from those releases while also adding some new test plugins
that are needed in the openstack-ansible-security ansible role.

This patch sets the upper constraint for Jinja2 to 2.9.5.

Change-Id: I8fb397b58d611028e25a3cbd0da837a876b0be54

commit_message:
make connection pool configurable

Change-Id: I5e677889ca61e9396377d0f45582134a011c592e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/63/397963/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - connection pool size configured using `poolsize` pool_size = self._get_param(params, 'poolsize', 10, int) kwargs = {'max_retries': self.max_retries, 'pool_connections': pool_size, 'pool_maxsize': pool_size} self.session.mount(self.target, adapters.HTTPAdapter(**kwargs))
deleted_lines: # TODO(gordc): support configurable max connections self.session.mount(self.target, adapters.HTTPAdapter(max_retries=self.max_retries))

commit_message:
make http publisher equivalent to dispatcher

we shouldn't have two things doing the same thing slightly differently.
this brings publisher and dispatcher to equivalency.

this patch:
- adds support for batch and verify_ssl
- fixes docstring on usage
- updates timeout default to 5s rather than 1s
- posts entire event rather than just subset (raw_only for old format)
- share a session rather than create new session each message

Change-Id: I8bc12064a8828b9a35af897740c25c377071f60d
Related-Bug: #1630570
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/71/396771/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: max_retries = self._get_param(params, 'max_retries', 2) poster = self._do_post if strutils.bool_from_string( params.get('batch')) else self._individual_post try: self.verify_ssl = strutils.bool_from_string( params.get('verify_ssl', strict=True) except ValueError: self.verify_ssl = params.get('verify_ssl') or True max_retries = 2 self.verify_ssl = True self.session = requests.Session() self.session.mount(self.target, adapters.HTTPAdapter(max_retries=max_retries)) def _individual_post(self, data): for d in data: self._do_post(d) LOG.trace('Message: %s', data) try: res = self.session.post(self.target, data=data, headers=self.headers, verify=self.verify_ssl, timeout=self.timeout) res.raise_for_status() LOG.debug('Message posting to %s: status code %d.', self.target, res.status_code) except requests.exceptions.HTTPError: LOG.exception(_LE('Status Code: %(code)s. ' 'Failed to dispatch message: %(data)s') % {'code': res.status_code, 'data': data}) data = self.poster([sample.as_dict() for sample in samples]) self._do_post([event.serialize() for event as events])
deleted_lines: self.max_retries = self._get_param(params, 'max_retries', 2) self.max_retries = 2 session = requests.Session() session.mount(self.target, adapters.HTTPAdapter(max_retries=self.max_retries)) content = ','.join([jsonutils.dumps(item) for item in data]) content = '[' + content + ']' LOG.debug('Data to be posted by HttpPublisher: %s', content) res = session.post(self.target, data=content, headers=self.headers, timeout=self.timeout) if res.status_code >= 300: LOG.error(_LE('Data post failed with status code %s'), res.status_code) data = [sample.as_dict() for sample in samples] self._do_post(data) data = [evt.as_dict()['raw']['payload'] for evt in events if evt.as_dict().get('raw', {}).get('payload')] self._do_post(data)

tree. This commit changes the gate-tempest-dsvm-full-lio job to do so.

commit_message:
Run Cinder in-tree tests: drbd-devstack

We want to run Cinder in-tree tests additionally to the one already in tempest
tree. This commit changes the gate-tempest-dsvm-full-drbd-devstack-nv job to do
so.

commit_message:
Run Cinder in-tree tests: zeromq-multibackend

We want to run Cinder in-tree tests additionally to the one already in tempest
tree. This commit changes the gate-tempest-dsvm-zeromq-multibackend job to do
so.

Change-Id: I135bbd850ed173c79f3e4f2d872d050cc2211757

commit_message:
Add multinode subnodes to inventory

For logs collecting from multinode subnodes we need to add them
to inventory. The adding itself is in dependency patch.

Depends-On: Ia45ea98b7ee0a9837ff22d509e128d2723f3161b
Change-Id: I77a1305bd6182eaceb4f69e873717c54df35ae36

commit_message:
Update Galera container config serially

A change to a galera container's bind mount configuration can cause a
restart of the container. Perform the 'Galera container config' play
serially to avoid a simultaneous restart of all galera containers within
an environment.

Change-Id: I23452067b5d2063e549bbdbb7fe4a08f016313c0
Related-Bug: #1659073

commit_message:
Fix building in oooq ovb jobs

Built packages weren't injected to overcloud images and weren't
injected on overcloud. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I3f3ffb88e5a4221dd8a28e809774ee41b6c1ceac

commit_message:
Add upgrade support for CephRGW service

Implements minor upgrade of the ceph-radosgw service.

Change-Id: I4c064bf996ec6bb7eba41ab6384bd953a8ec920f
Partially-Implements: blueprint overcloud-upgrades-per-service
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/60/423360/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: upgrade_tasks: - name: Gather RGW instance ID tags: step0 shell: hiera -c /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml ceph::profile::params::rgw_name radosgw.gateway register: rgw_id - name: Stop RGW instance tags: step1 service: name=ceph-radosgw@{{rgw_id.stdout}} pattern=ceph-radosgw state=stopped - name: Update RGW packages tags: step2 yum: name=ceph-radosgw state=latest - name: Start RGW service tags: step3 service: name=ceph-radosgw@{{rgw_id.stdout}} state=started

commit_message:
Converted the limits config to use systemd

The old limits config was still running on the upstart setup only. While
the directories within the ubuntu exist they are ignored in Ubuntu 16.04
and CentOS 7. This change moves the old upstart config into a template
and adds the required systemd config.

Change-Id: I9e5b9031cedf82ed3d1c2f9da2ab335d366620ce

commit_message:
Converted the limits config to use systemd

The old limits config was still running on the upstart setup. While the
directories within the ubuntu exist they are ignored in Ubuntu 16.04 and
CentOS 7. This change removes the old upstart config and adds the
required systemd config.

Change-Id: Ic75d6cfe32678f4205d6f8ea991f393526d0a082
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Remove greaterthan/lessthan test plugins

These test plugins are being moved to the openstack-ansible-security
so that it can operate independently of the openstack-ansible-plugins
role.

"""Extra tests for jinja2 templates in Ansible.""" def greater_than(value, reference_value): """Return true if value > reference_value.""" return value > reference_value def less_than(value, reference_value): """Return true if value < reference_value.""" return value < reference_value class TestModule: """Main test class from Ansible.""" def tests(self): """Add these tests to the list of tests available to Ansible.""" return { 'greater_than': greater_than, 'less_than': less_than, }

commit_message:
Restore RHEL 6 STIG content gating

When the role was switched to use RHEL 7 STIG content as the default,
the RHEL 6 STIG content was no longer being gated. This patch adds a
new test environment, `func_rhel6` and replaces the `func_rhel7`
environment with testing of the RHEL 6 STIG content. This is only
temporary and the `func_rhel7` environment should be removed as soon
as upstream gating is updated to use the new `func_rhel6` environment.

Change-Id: I9f91dac8ecadd3b791954f18e0607403ff147876
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/97/425697/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Always check for EFI

This patch ensures that the EFI check always runs. This fixes a bug
where the role fails when a tag is provided to the role at runtime.

Closes-bug: 1660391
Change-Id: I2cba58343910ec7e9b43e88ae26bec3b056eff81

commit_message:
Move test plugins into security role

The greaterthan/lessthan test plugins were added into
openstack-ansible-plugins a month ago, but they are needed in the
security role to ensure that the role can run on a system without
openstack-ansible-plugins installed.

The test plugins in this role should be removed once jinja 2.9.5 is
available for use in OpenStack (likely after Ocata release).

Closes-bug: 1660060
Change-Id: Ic86dc9a9e8ae8d03fe52a7c3fc52e580b9936711

commit_message:
Fix TypeError in api/neutron.py

In api/neutron.py [1], there is a logging, which throws a TypeError,
because the arguments of the format message is passed as a tuple,
which is not working when you pass the arguments to the logger,
instead of replacing in-place. In the current code, running the log
message leds to the following:

TypeError: not enough arguments for format string
Call stack:
  File "test.py", line 9, in <module>
    "router=%s", (router_id, router))
Message: 'router_static_route_list(): router_id=%s, router=%s'
Arguments: (('asd', 'asdf'),)

In this patchset, this bug is fixed.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/api/neutron.py#L1079

Change-Id: I233c435bb7ca89c6c8ecd49a66bccb5b59eedf41
Closes-Bug: #1659342
(cherry picked from commit 41ee8c0677b69f7d76092d76465d6f318e74c8b9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/45/426845/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.debug("router_static_route_list(): router_id=%(router_id)s, " "router=%(router)s", {'router_id': router_id, 'router': router})

commit_message:
Correctly set project_name

With newer keystone middleware tenant* isn't set, project* is. The
current neutron logic assumes tenant is the good values, and that
project should mirror it, but that logic actually needs to be
inverted.

In order to minimally impact unit tests as operations, the strategy
here is to just prefer project_name, but fall back to tenant_name if
project_name isn't filled out (this should basically never be the
case).

With this project_name shows up in the context log lines in devstack
again (it's been missing for some time).

Original-Commit: Ice6a4d046b492f02e3306627a760e5f4573f0fc6
Co-authored-by: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>

Change-Id: Ibea8c379328c8afd009df3f37019a6ba0b106d01
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/41/426441/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(sdague): tenant* is a deprecated set of names from # keystone, and is no longer set in modern keystone middleware # code, as such this is almost always going to be None. # prefer project_name, as that's what's going to be set by # keystone. Fall back if for some reason it's blank. 'tenant_name': self.project_name or self.tenant_name, 'project_name': self.project_name or self.tenant_name, # prefer project_name, as that's what's going to be set by # keystone. Fall back if for some reason it's blank. values['tenant_name'] = self.project_name or self.tenant_name values['project_name'] = self.project_name or self.tenant_name
deleted_lines: 'tenant_name': self.tenant_name, 'project_name': self.tenant_name, values['tenant_name'] = self.tenant_name values['project_name'] = self.tenant_name

commit_message:
Add i18n translation to others 3/3

This is 3 of 3 commits to add i18n translation to misc files.
Custom hacking rules will be added later to enforce this style.

Change-Id: I88284f61b5f37d78ad050a97c679f6bde23d832d
Depends-On: I6fb2bdcc4b83457e08b24599fb4a297ef6ec6c14

commit_message:
libvirt: allow any binding for vncserver_listen

This change in Nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/73428/

... means that we no longer need to restrict vncserver_listen parameter
to be configured on a certain binding.

Remove this restriction so deployments can set the compute IP instead of
0.0.0.0.

Closes-Bug: #1660099
Change-Id: I3fa050f94f9c95221bb71e16c70ad9128f8684dc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/12/426812/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: include ::nova::migration::libvirt
deleted_lines: if $vncserver_listen != '0.0.0.0' and $vncserver_listen != '::0' { fail('For migration support to work, you MUST set vncserver_listen to \'0.0.0.0\' or \'::0\'') } else { include ::nova::migration::libvirt }

commit_message:
Change permission for conf folder

According to the security guide config files should not be
reachable by any users except the owner and root.

Change-Id: I5caba528ae85a8209de7637ecfdd9407e10ea0df
(cherry picked from commit 0c570993670e12f141e72cd034ececd9fa256ad4)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone refs/changes/01/425201/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - { path: "/etc/keystone", mode: "0750" }

commit_message:
Set image_owner before adding location to glance

When image_upload_use_internal_tenant is set True, The image_owner
volume metadata must be added before its uuid is registered to
Glance's volume-backed image, so that glance cinder store can
verify the image owner.

Change-Id: I5aacf596896c0d59025af8afefd74b03ca48395b
Related-Bug: #1546507

commit_message:
Install python2.7 on xenial

Starting in 16.04 Ubuntu no longer installs python v2.7 by default.
Instead the default version of python is v3.5.  If you still need v2.7
then add the `python` package to this list

Change-Id: Ieb47e319ef2124570cc72acf1219c5b9d9fc9814

commit_message:
Add the md5 check on image

Add the md5 image hash check, if the image exists, check the md5
hash, if the hash is not the same, remove the old image and download
new one.

Change-Id: I2232129a814e89aaac9bf54ee16ede983fff5b48
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops refs/changes/01/426401/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Get ubuntu server image md5 hash file wget -O /tmp/MD5SUM5 /tmp/MD5SUM5 http://releases.ubuntu.com/"${DEFAULT_IMAGE:0:5}"/MD5SUMS # Get ubuntu server image, if the server image exists, compare the md5, rm and download new image if the hash is not # the same. md5=`md5sum ubuntu-"${DEFAULT_IMAGE}"-server-amd64.iso | awk '{ print $1 }'` if ! grep ${md5} /tmp/MD5SUMS &>/dev/null ; then rm /var/cache/iso/ubuntu-"${DEFAULT_IMAGE}"-server-amd64.iso wget http://releases.ubuntu.com/"${DEFAULT_IMAGE:0:5}"/ubuntu-"${DEFAULT_IMAGE}"-server-amd64.iso fi else wget http://releases.ubuntu.com/"${DEFAULT_IMAGE:0:5}"/ubuntu-"${DEFAULT_IMAGE}"-server-amd64.iso
deleted_lines: # Get ubuntu server image rm /var/cache/iso/ubuntu-"${DEFAULT_IMAGE}"-server-amd64.iso wget http://releases.ubuntu.com/"${DEFAULT_IMAGE:0:5}"/ubuntu-"${DEFAULT_IMAGE}"-server-amd64.iso

commit_message:
Revert "Remove events storage and API"

there are integration gaps we should test so we ensure we have
equivalent functionality:
- don't have ability to access panko via client.
- don't have tempest check to ensure ceilometer pushes to panko
- don't have tempest in panko but had it in ceilometer

This reverts commit 8d23f431ab0bd638edbf2197e56bea68d7b06a21.

Change-Id: Iee45b5a1f51cf65a2b3d215a5627dc11cb512bb9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/80/418480/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Copyright 2012 New Dream Network, LLC (DreamHost) # Copyright 2013 IBM Corp. # Copyright 2013 eNovance <licensing@enovance.com> # Copyright Ericsson AB 2013. All rights reserved # Copyright 2014 Hewlett-Packard Company # Copyright 2015 Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import datetime from oslo_log import log import pecan from pecan import rest import six import wsme from wsme import types as wtypes import wsmeext.pecan as wsme_pecan from ceilometer.api.controllers.v2 import base from ceilometer.api.controllers.v2 import utils as v2_utils from ceilometer.api import rbac from ceilometer.event import storage from ceilometer.event.storage import models as event_models from ceilometer.i18n import _, _LE LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) class TraitDescription(base.Base): """A description of a trait, with no associated value.""" type = wtypes.text "the data type, defaults to string" name = wtypes.text "the name of the trait" @classmethod def sample(cls): return cls(name='service', type='string' ) class EventQuery(base.Query): """Query arguments for Event Queries.""" _supported_types = ['integer', 'float', 'string', 'datetime'] type = wsme.wsattr(wtypes.text, default='string') "the type of the trait filter, defaults to string" def __repr__(self): # for logging calls return '<EventQuery %r %s %r %s>' % (self.field, self.op, self._get_value_as_type(), self.type) @classmethod def sample(cls): return cls(field="event_type", type="string", op="eq", value="compute.instance.create.start") class Trait(base.Base): """A Trait associated with an event.""" name = wtypes.text "The name of the trait" value = wtypes.text "the value of the trait" type = wtypes.text "the type of the trait (string, integer, float or datetime)" @staticmethod def _convert_storage_trait(trait): """Helper method to convert a storage model into an API trait instance. If an API trait instance is passed in, just return it. """ if isinstance(trait, Trait): return trait value = (six.text_type(trait.value) if not trait.dtype == event_models.Trait.DATETIME_TYPE else trait.value.isoformat()) trait_type = event_models.Trait.get_name_by_type(trait.dtype) return Trait(name=trait.name, type=trait_type, value=value) @classmethod def sample(cls): return cls(name='service', type='string', value='compute.hostname' ) class Event(base.Base): """A System event.""" message_id = wtypes.text "The message ID for the notification" event_type = wtypes.text "The type of the event" _traits = None def get_traits(self): return self._traits def set_traits(self, traits): self._traits = map(Trait._convert_storage_trait, traits) traits = wsme.wsproperty(wtypes.ArrayType(Trait), get_traits, set_traits) "Event specific properties" generated = datetime.datetime "The time the event occurred" raw = base.JsonType() "The raw copy of notification" @classmethod def sample(cls): return cls( event_type='compute.instance.update', generated=datetime.datetime(2015, 1, 1, 12, 0, 0, 0), message_id='94834db1-8f1b-404d-b2ec-c35901f1b7f0', traits={ Trait(name='request_id', value='req-4e2d67b8-31a4-48af-bb2f-9df72a353a72'), Trait(name='service', value='conductor.tem-devstack-01'), Trait(name='tenant_id', value='7f13f2b17917463b9ee21aa92c4b36d6') }, raw={'status': {'nested': 'started'}} ) def _build_rbac_query_filters(): filters = {'t_filter': [], 'admin_proj': None} # Returns user_id, proj_id for non-admins user_id, proj_id = rbac.get_limited_to(pecan.request.headers) # If non-admin, filter events by user and project if user_id and proj_id: filters['t_filter'].append({"key": "project_id", "string": proj_id, "op": "eq"}) filters['t_filter'].append({"key": "user_id", "string": user_id, "op": "eq"}) elif not user_id and not proj_id: filters['admin_proj'] = pecan.request.headers.get('X-Project-Id') return filters def _event_query_to_event_filter(q): evt_model_filter = { 'event_type': None, 'message_id': None, 'start_timestamp': None, 'end_timestamp': None } filters = _build_rbac_query_filters() traits_filter = filters['t_filter'] admin_proj = filters['admin_proj'] for i in q: if not i.op: i.op = 'eq' elif i.op not in base.operation_kind: error = (_('Operator %(operator)s is not supported. The supported' ' operators are: %(supported)s') % {'operator': i.op, 'supported': base.operation_kind}) raise base.ClientSideError(error) if i.field in evt_model_filter: if i.op != 'eq' and i.field in ('event_type', 'message_id'): error = (_('Operator %(operator)s is not supported. Only' ' `eq\' operator is available for field' ' %(field)s') % {'operator': i.op, 'field': i.field}) raise base.ClientSideError(error) if i.op != 'ge' and i.field == 'start_timestamp': error = (_('Operator %(operator)s is not supported. Only' ' `ge\' operator is available for field' ' %(field)s') % {'operator': i.op, 'field': i.field}) raise base.ClientSideError(error) if i.op != 'le' and i.field == 'end_timestamp': error = (_('Operator %(operator)s is not supported. Only' ' `le\' operator is available for field' ' %(field)s') % {'operator': i.op, 'field': i.field}) raise base.ClientSideError(error) evt_model_filter[i.field] = i.value else: trait_type = i.type or 'string' traits_filter.append({"key": i.field, trait_type: i._get_value_as_type(), "op": i.op}) return storage.EventFilter(traits_filter=traits_filter, admin_proj=admin_proj, **evt_model_filter) class TraitsController(rest.RestController): """Works on Event Traits.""" @v2_utils.requires_admin @wsme_pecan.wsexpose([Trait], wtypes.text, wtypes.text) def get_one(self, event_type, trait_name): """Return all instances of a trait for an event type. :param event_type: Event type to filter traits by :param trait_name: Trait to return values for """ LOG.debug("Getting traits for %s", event_type) return [Trait._convert_storage_trait(t) for t in pecan.request.event_storage_conn .get_traits(event_type, trait_name)] @v2_utils.requires_admin @wsme_pecan.wsexpose([TraitDescription], wtypes.text) def get_all(self, event_type): """Return all trait names for an event type. :param event_type: Event type to filter traits by """ get_trait_name = event_models.Trait.get_name_by_type return [TraitDescription(name=t['name'], type=get_trait_name(t['data_type'])) for t in pecan.request.event_storage_conn .get_trait_types(event_type)] class EventTypesController(rest.RestController): """Works on Event Types in the system.""" traits = TraitsController() @v2_utils.requires_admin @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(None, wtypes.text) def get_one(self, event_type): """Unused API, will always return 404. :param event_type: A event type """ pecan.abort(404) @v2_utils.requires_admin @wsme_pecan.wsexpose([six.text_type]) def get_all(self): """Get all event types.""" return list(pecan.request.event_storage_conn.get_event_types()) class EventsController(rest.RestController): """Works on Events.""" @v2_utils.requires_context @wsme_pecan.wsexpose([Event], [EventQuery], int) def get_all(self, q=None, limit=None): """Return all events matching the query filters. :param q: Filter arguments for which Events to return :param limit: Maximum number of samples to be returned. """ rbac.enforce("events:index", pecan.request) q = q or [] limit = v2_utils.enforce_limit(limit) event_filter = _event_query_to_event_filter(q) return [Event(message_id=event.message_id, event_type=event.event_type, generated=event.generated, traits=event.traits, raw=event.raw) for event in pecan.request.event_storage_conn.get_events(event_filter, limit)] @v2_utils.requires_context @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(Event, wtypes.text) def get_one(self, message_id): """Return a single event with the given message id. :param message_id: Message ID of the Event to be returned """ rbac.enforce("events:show", pecan.request) filters = _build_rbac_query_filters() t_filter = filters['t_filter'] admin_proj = filters['admin_proj'] event_filter = storage.EventFilter(traits_filter=t_filter, admin_proj=admin_proj, message_id=message_id) events = [event for event in pecan.request.event_storage_conn.get_events(event_filter)] if not events: raise base.EntityNotFound(_("Event"), message_id) if len(events) > 1: LOG.error(_LE("More than one event with " "id %s returned from storage driver") % message_id) event = events[0] return Event(message_id=event.message_id, event_type=event.event_type, generated=event.generated, traits=event.traits, raw=event.raw)

commit_message:
Add the release notes for most changes after 0.3.0

This is to catch up with the existing changes, let's try to be more
strict about changes with no release notes (starting by me).

Change-Id: I2cb331bcb8421caa797aff05df9b1b8ea4dd8be4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-tests refs/changes/62/426862/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: | Fixes and addition for the API and CLI tests. Support for CDH 5.9 in scenario tests. Less parameters required for scenario tests. features: - The Tempest-based tests have received an increase of the coverage for both API and CLI tests (job, plugins, templates; negative testing). - CDH 5.9 can be tested thanks to the addition of the specific templates. - Few parameters are not required anymore by the templates in scenario tests; a default value is provided (name of templates, etc). - The flavors used in templates are now parameters too. - If a flavor name is provided in addition to its specification and a flavor with that name exists, it is used and not created again. - The dependencies on non-public Tempest interfaces have been removed. upgrade: - the name of the variables/parameters used for the name of the images in the scenario tests have been changes to follow a more consistent pattern. critical: - The Tempest plugin was fixed after the removal of the data_processing plugin from the tempest repository. Most of the work was in place, only a small change was missing. fixes: - The artifacts created during the execution of CLI tests are properly cleaned at the end of the tests. other: - The documentation was improved (scenario tests) and extended (Tempest plugin).

commit_message:
tripleo.sh: gather subnet id using openstackclient

the current way of gathering subnet id from the network list using
neutron client seems to have become inconsistent.
using openstackclient for gathering should provide a more consistent way
to get the subnet id value to be updated

Change-Id: If69e599a1ec352057740fdfbbabb3a39a0090208

commit_message:
Implement NFS multi backend support

The NFS implementation based off cinder_nfs_client
does not support per cinder backend configuration,
separating NFS mounts per backend.
This fix removes cinder_nfs_client in favor of
fully supporting multi cinder backends over the
cinder_backends stanza.

Closes-Bug #1657203

Change-Id: I817ff372c2d58e999a89496fce3d25dc617216f0
(cherry picked from commit e6c2b14c717568b6f6284e614d170081c4283cce)

commit_message:
Change the order of upgrade operations to maximise API uptime

The rabbitmq container restart and upgrade process can impact API
service availability. To correct this issue the forced rabbitmq
container restart has been moved down to just before the rabbitmq
upgrade playbook.

Closes-Bug #1632040
Change-Id: I3afdc95da1a18db455b6da4c2ae2e4c1783ff73a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Enable release notes translation

Releasenote translation publishing is being prepared. 'locale_dirs'
needs to be defined in conf.py to generate translated version of the
release notes.

Note that this repository might not get translated release notes - or
no translations at all - but we add the entry here nevertheless to
prepare for it.

Change-Id: I932d28bc77c98a790c62c4b6bdd4b6191443e8c1

commit_message:
Update py35 functional tests blacklist

We have merged some python 3 compatibility commits and merged
new code recently. Both of them affect blacklist of functinal-py35,
so update with latest status, then we can fix tests in blacklist.
We aslo enable py35 functional test job in
https://review.openstack.org/410105 to avoid regression.

Partially-Implements: blueprint goal-python35

Change-Id: I0ffb097c2713f714b7a4e8728f9c67b673e10ddb

commit_message:
Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim
support for Python 3.5 in the classifier.
This patch also adds the convenience py35 venv

Change-Id: I8950bf3a7fe6c97bf973658e409e39953470f40d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-designateclient refs/changes/33/423033/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py35,py27,flake8

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-17 09:27:15.000000000', 'files': ['designatedashboard/dashboards/project/dns_domains/forms.py', 'requirements.txt', 'designatedashboard/dashboards/project/dns_domains/tables.py', 'designatedashboard/api/designate.py', 'designatedashboard/api/rest/passthrough.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate-dashboard/commit/9fdd096bdacacc43d9788b8097b2723c6423a17a', 'message': 'Switch to oslo_log

commit_message:
Switch to oslo_log

Designate dashboard is currently using python logging module to
implement logging functionality.
This patch made a switch to oslo.log(logging for openstack projects)

Reference:-
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.log

Change-Id: I31b8398e45743a9f797882988d62d779edb89f86
Closes-Bug: #1656167
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-dashboard refs/changes/69/421169/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_log import log as logging

commit_message:
[WIP] Fail on SHA from master when stable branch exists

Change-Id: Iedab75a212ad48b49af4e09697598f3ff24a5a95
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/79/410379/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def check_branch_exists(workdir, repo, series): "Check if the targeted branch exists." remote_match = 'remotes/origin/stable/%s' % series try: subprocess.check_call( ['git', 'rev-parse', '--verify', remote_match], cwd=os.path.join(workdir, repo), ) return True except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e: print('ERROR checking branch exists: %s' % e) return False

commit_message:
Remove support for py33 and update to py35

Python 3.3 is not supported from Mitaka, as per Infra.
This patch removes the support and update to py35
for the same. Updated in venv also.

Change-Id: Ida50a9b6415cfc19bdbe37b3f6a60dc4c7aca73a

commit_message:
Switch to decorators.idempotent_id

test.idempotent_id is being kept temporary to migrate
to new lib interface. Now idempotent_id is available as Tempest stable
interface decorators and all plugins tests using the old decorator
should be switched to new interface.

In future, Once all plugins are switched to new decorator Tempest
will remove the test.idempotent_id

This commit correct the example tests in doc.
Related-Bug: 1616913

Change-Id: I4c8eb461a04072403d5bf0e03cefae8df03999f0

commit_message:
Fix noop metrics timed decorator

Previously if you did not have the monasca statds available, the @timed
decorator would result in a NoneType error because timed was returning
None instead of acting as a noop function wrapper. This change updates
the NoopTimer to properly handle timed being used as a function.

Change-Id: Ic5543b3503b24aaef960d8b7c0cb38940241cbcb
Closes-Bug: #1659638

subject: Handle unreadable hashes.pkl same way as non-existent or corrupt
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-18 16:16:27.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/874b99fbc70f88505288587636a274710bf40f36', 'message': 'Handle unreadable hashes.pkl same way as non-existent or corrupt

If hashes.pkl does not exist or does not contain pickled data then
hashes is set to None which triggers an attempt to create a valid
hashes.pkl.

In contrast, if hashes.pkl exists but cannot be read then hashes
is explicitly set to an empty dict, which may not trigger any
attempt to write a valid hashes.pkl.

Furthermore, if hashes.pkl exists but cannot be read and
hashes.invalid has invalidations, then the invalidated suffixes
will be added to an empty hashes dict and written to a new
hashes.pkl file, losing any prior suffix hash state.

Co-Authored-By: Pavel Kvasnika <pavel.kvasnicka@firma.seznam.cz>
Change-Id: I8f6bb89beaaca3beec2e6063299189f52e9eee51
'}]
commit_message:
Handle unreadable hashes.pkl same way as non-existent or corrupt

If hashes.pkl does not exist or does not contain pickled data then
hashes is set to None which triggers an attempt to create a valid
hashes.pkl.

In contrast, if hashes.pkl exists but cannot be read then hashes
is explicitly set to an empty dict, which may not trigger any
attempt to write a valid hashes.pkl.

Furthermore, if hashes.pkl exists but cannot be read and
hashes.invalid has invalidations, then the invalidated suffixes
will be added to an empty hashes dict and written to a new
hashes.pkl file, losing any prior suffix hash state.

Co-Authored-By: Pavel Kvasnika <pavel.kvasnicka@firma.seznam.cz>
Change-Id: I8f6bb89beaaca3beec2e6063299189f52e9eee51
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/76/422076/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :returns: the hashes, or None if hashes.pkl is corrupt, cannot be read or does not exist :raises OSError: if there is a problem reading or clearing hashes.invalid hashes = None if hashes is not None: modified = False try: with open(invalidations_file, 'rb') as inv_fh: for line in inv_fh: suffix = line.strip() if hashes.get(suffix, '') is not None: hashes[suffix] = None modified = True except (IOError, OSError) as e: if e.errno != errno.ENOENT: raise if modified: write_pickle(hashes, hashes_file, partition_dir, PICKLE_PROTOCOL) # Note: if we failed to read the current hashes.pkl then we still clear # hashes.invalid on the assumption that (a) the return value of None in # the current process should trigger recalculation of hashes and a # write to hashes.pkl in _get_hashes and (b) any other process # attempting to read hashes.pkl will also fail and similarly consider # hashes to be None. If another process were in fact to succeed in # reading the hashes.pkl that the current process failed to read, then # there is a risk that we are throwing away invalidation state which # the other process should have consolidated into hashes.pkl. It might # therefore be safer to *always* write a hashes.pkl inside this # lock_path before clearing hashes.pkl. try: with open(invalidations_file, 'wb'):
deleted_lines: :returns: the hashes, or None if there's no hashes.pkl. hashes = {} modified = False try: with open(invalidations_file, 'rb') as inv_fh: for line in inv_fh: suffix = line.strip() if hashes is not None and \ hashes.get(suffix, '') is not None: hashes[suffix] = None modified = True except (IOError, OSError) as e: if e.errno != errno.ENOENT: raise if modified: write_pickle(hashes, hashes_file, partition_dir, PICKLE_PROTOCOL) try: with open(invalidations_file, 'wb') as inv_fh:
